loans.use: to buy chairs, work drawers, and equipment for his barber shop.

loans.name: Lina Evelyn

texts.es:
Higuerón es un lugar muy cercano a la ciudad de Portoviejo rodeado de mucha vegetación en la cual la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura, cría de animales  con la cual pueden sacar adelante a sus familias, aquí se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Grupo De Crédito San Antonio De Higuerón.
Aquí vive la señora Lina, tiene 39 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de  esta  relación tienen tres hijos de 21, 14 y 11  años  de edad, los dos menores estudian en colegio y  escuela. Su esposo es chofer y tiene un taller de cerrajería.
Doña Lina como muchas otras del lugar tratan de colaborar de alguna u otra forma para salir adelante, ella tiene una pequeña granja en la cual cría pollos los mismos que mantiene por espacio de tres meses y luego los vende a particulares por su casa, de esta forma ella contribuye con algo para sacar adelante a su familia, parte del crédito lo utiliza  su esposo, él tiene un taller de cerrajería, allí fabrica puertas, ventanas y otras estructuras de hierro, para ellos los créditos son muy importantes es así como pueden sacar adelante sus negocios y cada día mejorar su calidad de vida, ellos agradecen mucho a la fundación Espoir y a las personas que ayudan para que ellos puedan tener un crédito y mejorar su vida.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que es la única forma que tienen para solventar gastos en sus negocios con lo cual ganan el pan diario para ella y su familia. Este nuevo crédito es para comprar pollos, hierro, pintura y otros  materiales necesarios en el taller. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que reciben. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Higuerón is a place very close to the city of Portoviejo, surrounded by a great deal of vegetation. A majority of people who live there farm and raise animals, enabling them to support their families. Here the members of the Antonio De Higuerón communal bank meet every two weeks.

Lina lives here. She is 39 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children ages 21,14 and 11. The two youngest go to high school and primary school. Her husband is a driver and has a metalwork shop.

Lina, like many other people in the area try to contribute in some way or the other to supporting their households. She has a small chicken coop where  she raises chickens. She looks after them for three months and then sells them to individuals from her home. In this way she contributes something to supporting her family. Her husband uses part of the loan. He has a metalwork shop, and there he makes doors, windows and other metal structures. 

The loans are very important for them, as this is how they can keep their businesses going, and each day improve their quality of life.  
They are very grateful to the Fundación Espoir and to the people who help, so that they can obtain a loan and improve their lives. She is obtaining a consecutive loan as it is the only way they have to meet the expenses for the businesses with which they support their family. 

This new loan is to buy chickens, as well as steel, paint and other materials needed in the workshop. She has been with the communal bank for four loan cycles, and likes it because of the help they receive. Their dream is to move forward in life and do their best for their children.

loans.use: To buy chickens, rebar, paint, and other materials.

loans.name: Katiuska María

texts.es:
Higuerón es un lugar muy cercano a la ciudad de Portoviejo rodeado de mucha vegetación en la cual la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura, cría de animales  con la cual pueden sacar adelante a sus familias, aquí se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Grupo De Crédito San Antonio De Higuerón.
En este lugar vive la señora Katiuska, tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 7 y 4  años de edad, ambos estudian en una escuela de la localidad. Ella vive con sus hijos. 
Doña Katiuska con la intención de ganarse la vida  y con esto poder salir adelante ya que es padre y madre a la vez se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y zapatos por catalogo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, sale en horas de la mañana cuando sus hijos están estudiando, deja a crédito y va cobrando cada 8 días, son 8 años que lleva con esta actividad con la cual saca adelante a sus hijos.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito para comprar ropa y zapatos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Higuerón is very close to the city of Portoviejo and is surrounded by lots of vegetation. Most of its residents work in agriculture and animal husbandry, which allows them to support their families. Here, the members of the San Antonio De Higuerón communal bank meet every 15 days.

Katiuska, 28, lives in this area. She is a single mother of two children, ages 7 and 4, who both go to school in the town. She lives with her children.

With the intention of earning a living and getting ahead since she is both mother and father, Katuiska makes a living selling. She sells all types of clothing and shoes by catalog. She sells door to door. Katiuska goes out in the morning when her children are in school. She sells on credit and collects payment every 8 days. She has had this business activity for 8 years, with which she supports her children.

Katiuska is requesting a loan to buy clothes and shoes. She has been with the communal bank since it started and she likes it because the loans allow her to get ahead. Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Taufaalili

texts.en:
Taufaalili is a 56-year-old mother with 10 children. She has a small business of sewing clothes and selling them in her community to earn a living. 

Taufaalili has requested a loan to buy material rolls, needles, a sewing machine, and a tape measure to help her with the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. She will use her profit to expand her business. Taufaalili became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy material rolls, needles, a sewing machine and a tape measure

loans.name: Taele

texts.en:
Taele is a 31-year-old mother with four children. She owns and operates a small business of selling elei (fabric) printing materials at the market to earn a living. 

Taele has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, a paint brush, elei designs, containers and a printing machine to assist her in running the business. 

She has been doing this for more than two years. Taele hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, a paint brush, elei designs, containers and a printing machine

loans.name: Lagi

texts.en:
Lagi is 60 years old with two children. She operates a business of selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Lagi has requested a loan to buy banana tube (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel and chemicals to assist her in running the business. She joined SPBD in 2014 and hopes to use her business profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, shovel and chemicals

loans.name: Gullermo Ramon

texts.es:
Guillermo es un hombre emprendedor, responsable y honesto, de 36 años. Es mecánico automotriz. El desde hace 7 años ofrece el servicio de taller de mecánica. Inicio en esta profesión luego de que fue ayudante en otro trabajo;  luego de adquirir un poco de experiencia decidió estudiar un técnico en mecánica para posteriormente ofrecer sus servicios a clientes hasta alcanzar el éxito que tienen ahora. Su único apoyo en su trabajo son su hermano y dos trabajadores.
 
Él solicita el crédito porque desea invertir en la compra de materiales para su taller, cómo: repuestos mecánicos para los vehículos, lo cual, le permitirá mejorar su demanda de clientes, ganancias y ofrecer un mejor servicio. Sus metas son cada día mejor más su negocio y ofrecer un servicio automotriz completo.
texts.en:
Guillermo, 36 years old, is an enterprising man, responsible and honest. He is a mechanic and for seven years he's offered his services in auto repair. 

He started this occupation after working as assistant elsewhere. Having acquired a little experience, he decided to study and become a  technician so he could offer his services as he successfully does now. He is assisted by his brother and two workers.

He is requesting the loan to invest in shop supplies such as spare parts. This will allow him to better meet customer needs, improve the service and get more income.

His goal is to improve the shop every day so that he can offer complete automotive services.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his automotive shop such as spare parts.

loans.name: María Natividad

texts.es:
Higuerón es un lugar muy cercano a la ciudad de Portoviejo rodeado de mucha vegetación en la cual la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura, cría de animales  con la cual pueden sacar adelante a sus familias, aquí se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Grupo De Crédito San Antonio De Higuerón.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 39 años de edad, está divorciada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 9 y 7 años de edad, ambos estudian en escuela.
Doña María es una mujer que le toca trabajar muy duro para salir adelante y así darles lo necesario a sus hijos, ella tiene un comedor en un local que arrienda en el mercado local, ella todas las mañanas prepara deliciosos desayunos que son del agrado de su distinguida clientela que a diario se sirven lo que ella prepara y que es de mucha variedad, allí prepara secos de pollo, pescado, hígado, entre otros, lleva 3 años con este negocio el cual le deja lo necesario para salir adelante y darles a sus hijos una buena educación.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Lleva tres ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan la fundación y las personas que hacen posible que ella reciba su crédito.  Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Higuerón is very close to the city of Portoviejo and is surrounded by lots of vegetation. Most of its residents work in agriculture and animal husbandry, which allows them to support their families. Here, the members of the San Antonio De Higuerón communal bank meet every 15 days.

María, 39, lives in this area. She is divorced and has two children from that relationship, ages 9 and 7. They are both in school.

María is a woman who has to work very hard to get ahead so she can provide her children with what they need. She has an eatery in a premises that she rents at the local market. Every morning, she prepares delicious breakfasts that are liked by her distinguished customers who she serves what she prepares daily, which is plenty of variety. There she prepares chicken, fish, and liver stews, among other things. She has had this business for 3 years and it gives her what she needs to get ahead and to give her children a good education.

This loan will be used to buy rice, meat, fish, and other ingredients to prepare her dishes. She has been a member of her communal bank for 3 loan cycles and she likes it because of the help the bank gives her and for the people who make it possible for her to receive a loan. Her dream is to have a great restaurant and to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to by rice, meat, fish, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a sugarcane farming business in the Philippines for 11 years.  She earns additional income from food vending, fish selling and pig fattening.  Leonida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.

Leonida is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her sugarcane farming business.  She successfully repaid her previous loan and has now requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Margarita works hard to support her family.

She operates a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and fattening pigs.  Margarita is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional groceries like canned goods, soft-drinks, diapers and school supplies.

Margarita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like canned goods, soft-drinks, diapers and school supplies.

loans.name: Uiesemalii

texts.en:
Uiesemalii is a 25-year-old mother of 2 children. She owns and operates a small business of selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Uiesemalii has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine to assist her in running the business.

Uiesemalii hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Uliuli

texts.en:
Uliuli is a 37-year-old mother of 1 child.   She owns and operates a small business selling pancakes, pork cake, and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Uliuli  has  requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoons, and frying pans to assist her in the operation of the the business. 

She hopes to use her profits to build a small bakery store in the near future. 

Uliuli  joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoons, and frying pans

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 56 years old, married to Jane, and blessed with 4 children aged 10, 8, 6, and 3 years old.  Evans is a farmer, a business he has operated for the last five years, earning a monthly income of 12,000 KES.

William has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the entire loan amount to buy a dairy cow for milk surplus.  The anticipated profits will be used to buy additional cows for rearing.

William hopes to grow his business and become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to produce more milk to sell to clients.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora is 37 years old, married, and blessed with one child.  

She owns a beauty salon at Voi Kenya.  She has managed her business for the last nine years earning a great income.

This marks her first time borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to purchase beauty creams, soaps, and hair weaves. 

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her son and expand her business. 

In the future, she hopes to earn more income and open several salons.

loans.use: to purchase beauty creams, soaps, and hair weaves

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 49 years old, married to Desmond and blessed with five children between 26 and 15 years old, respectively. Grace sells clothes, a business she has done for the last 21 years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,800. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production in order to add more income. 

Her plans are to use the profits to repay the loan and the remaining cash to open a boutique shop. 

She hopes to be financially stable and fulfill her dream in life of having her own boutique.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production in order to earn more income

loans.name: Jovelinda

texts.en:
Jovelinda is 57 years old, married, and has four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jovelinda has a soft-drinks retailing business in the Philippines.  Jovelinda has been in this business for 15 years. 

Jovelinda requested a 23,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more drinks to sell.

In the future, Jovelinda would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Nema

texts.en:
Nema is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Nema has been in this business for 11 years. Nema earns more income from pig fattening and rice retailing.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Nema has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is 64 years old and married with seven children.

Isabelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Isabelita has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Isabelita aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Shirley works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

Shirley is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to  purchase additional ingredients like flour, yeast, sugar, etc for her food vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Shirley has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, yeast, sugar, etc

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 48 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Ruth is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers and to pay the laborers' salaries for cleaning the farm.

Ruth has been farming sugarcane for 20 years and earns additional income from fish vending, food vending and pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer and pay laborers' salaries for cleaning the farm

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is 47 years old, married, and ha three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Magdalina has a food vending business in the Philippines.  Magdalina has been in this business for five years. 

Magdalina requested a 21,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

In the future, Magdalina would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to cover  labor costs for weeding.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene sells prepared food and silver jewelry in her village. Her husband is a company driver. 

Arlene has been engaed in this business for eight years.  

Arlene has two grown children and one of them is already married and has a child. 

Arlene wishes to increase her income to be able to provide for her grandchild. 

Arlene is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy raw meat, hot dogs, and meat balls to sell. She will also use the loan to purchase silver jewelry to sell for additional income. 

Arlene hopes to increase her income so that someday she will attain her wish.

loans.use: to buy raw meat, hot dogs, and meat balls to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for milk production to enable him to buy more motorcycles for transporting people and goods to several places

loans.name: Yuvinalis

texts.en:
Yuvinalis is 29 years old, married to Agnes, and blessed with three children aged 13, 10 and 8 years old.

He transports oil to several parts of the country, a business he has done for the last 5 years, earning a monthly income of 8,000 KES. 

Yuvinalis has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production.  The profits from he milk production will enable him to educate his children. 

His plans are to use the gained profits to repay the loan and the remaining cash to pay school fees for his children. 

His hope is to be financially stable and start a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Julinda

texts.en:
Julinda is 63 years old, married, and has eleven children, one of whom is in school.  Julinda works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase canned goods, diapers, school supplies, and grocery items.

She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Julinda has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Julinda aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, diapers, school supplies, and grocery items for sale

loans.name: Zavqiya

texts.ru: Завкия 25 летняя жительница маленького городка Конибодом. Конибодом находится на северной части Республики. Завкия замужем. Ее муж вместе с ее отцом и братом уехал на заработки в Российскую Федерацию. Завкия со своей свекровью работает на Родине. Она покупает абрикосы, сушит их и делает из них сухофрукты. Завкия решила расширить не большой бизнес. Она надеется получить заемные средства и потратить их на приобретения абрикосов.
texts.en: Zavqiya is 25 years old, married, and she lives in the small city of Konibodom, located in northern Tajikistan.  Her husband, father and brother have all left the country to work as migrant workers in Russia.  Zavqiya and her mother-in-law have stayed in their homeland and work there. Zavqiya buys apricots, dries them and processes them into dried fruits.  She has now decided to expand her small business.  She is hoping to borrow some money in order to buy apricots.

loans.use: to buy apricots and process them into dried fruits.

loans.name: Muqaddas

texts.ru: Мукаддас жительница не большого северного городка под названием Исфара. Ей 57 лет. Она замужем, но ее муж, как и многие граждане Республики Таджикистана, находится за приделами Родины на заработках. У нее в браке имеется двое детей. Макаддас дома занимается выращиванием скотов. Она покупает скотин, откармливает их в течение определенного времени и после вывозит на продажу. Таким не хитрым способом Мукаддас зарабатывает на жизнь. Причина обращения ее за кредитом является расширения бизнеса. Она хочет увеличить поголовья скотин за счет заемных средств и повысить доход. Мукаддас надеется, что сможет осуществить свой план с помощью кредита, и вы можете предоставить ей такую возможность.
texts.en: Muqaddas lives in the small city of Isfara, located in northern Tajikistan.  She is 57 years old and married.  Her husband, like many Tajik citizens, is currently living and working abroad.  Muqaddas is the mother of two children.  She is involved in animal husbandry and she raises livestock at home.  She buys livestock, fattens her animals for a determined period of time and then resells them.  This is her way of making a living.  Muqaddas is taking a loan in order to expand her business.  She will use her loan to increase her cattle headcount and her income.  She hopes that this loan will allow her to achieve her goals.  Thank you for giving her the opportunity to do so.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and expand her business.

loans.name: Ma.teresa

texts.en: Ma. Teresa, aged 43, is married to a driver and they're blessed with seven children. The picture above was after she sold her bananas. Ma. Teresa has sold bananas for almost one year and earns a net income of PHP 3,000 weekly. Her net profits are usually spent on purchasing vegetables to sell to generate additional income. Due to insufficient capital in her business she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 to purchase 2,000 kilos of bananas to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase 2,000 kilos of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Adora

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Adora works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Adora is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Adora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 59 years old and widowed with six children.

Margarita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Margarita has been in this business for four years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Margarita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her business.

Nida has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Nida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 34 years old, married to Charles and blessed with five children aged 15, 13, 10, 8 and 3 years old.

She has been selling chips in the market for the last 10 years and earns a monthly income of KES 7,800.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production to enable her to educate her children.

Her plans are to use the gained profits to repay the loan and the remaining cash to pay school fees for her children.

Her hope is to be financially stable and start a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production to enable her to educate her children.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, two of whom are attending school. She also looks after her mother. She has been selling charcoal in the market at retail for the last eight years, working seven days a week. She gets additional income from selling used clothes. She has requested a loan of UGX 900,000 from MCDT- SACCO to stock more sacks of charcoal . Her business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her dream is to educate her children to the university level. She joined MCDT because of the school fees loan product and the relatively low interest charged on loans. She lives in her own house with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Dolores successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Dolores's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Maclean

texts.en:
Maclean lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and three of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells chips at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last five years. She works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 900,000 UGX from MCDT–SACCO to buy cabbages, beef, chicken, tomato sauce, a jerrycan of cooking oil, and Irish potatoes. Her major business challenge is thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspiration are to own a fully established restaurant. 

She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but no access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, beef, chicken, tomato sauce, and a jerrycan of cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and in turn make more tea in his hotel and meet his customers' needs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable her to increase milk production and satistfy customer demand for milk.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, shampoo, etc. for her general store business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from food vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business making coconut roofing in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase split bamboo, plastic rope, etc. for her business making coconut roofing.

Annaliza has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from farming rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase split bamboo, plastic rope, etc.

loans.name: Mapenzi

texts.en:
Mapenzi is a married woman with four kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mapenzi operates a grocery/vegetables selling stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanalima operates a grocery/vegetables stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of competition in her business.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is engaged in rice farming for her livelihood. She grows and sells rice. She is a 47-year old married woman with six children from Getafe, Bohol. Four of her children are still attending school. Aside from that, she also engages in the making and selling of katig (an outrigger of a small boat). She has been engaged in rice farming for more than 10 years.

She has requested a loan to buy fertilizers. These materials will help improve her farm to gain more yield. With this, she will be able to augment her income and provide her family with healthy diets. She could then balance her finances and settle her obligations.

Victoria hopes that she will be able to use both sources of income to provide her children with quality education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Milagros works hard to support her family.

She has a dress and curtain making business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending.  Milagros is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase linens, threads, etc. for her dress and curtain making business.

Milagros has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase linens, threads, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable her to buy napier grass to feed her dairy cows, increase milk production and satistfy her customers' demands for milk

loans.name: Evelyn Edith

texts.es:
Higuerón es un lugar muy cercano a la ciudad de Portoviejo rodeado de mucha vegetación en la cual la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura, cría de animales  con la cual pueden sacar adelante a sus familias, aquí se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Grupo De Crédito San Antonio De Higuerón.
En este lugar vive la señora Evelyn, tiene 21 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  pero aun no tiene hijos. Su esposo es chofer. Ella estudia en un centro de estudios superiores en la ciudad.
Ella es una mujer muy luchadora que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ir mejorando día a día en su vida familiar y profesional se dedica a la venta de productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), ella vende de forma informal ya sea en el lugar donde estudia o por la localidad la cual recorre tres o cuatro días por semana cuando está desocupada, deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. De esta forma y gracias  a los créditos recibidos por la institución y personas que contribuyen con sus aportaciones ella puede cumplir sus sueños de ser una profesional y en un día futuro brindar a sus hijos cuando los tenga un mejor porvenir.
Esta repitiendo el crédito ya que es así como ella puede aprovechar cuando los productos están de oferta que son los que más ganancias les dejan, sus ganancias las invierte en su educación ya que los gastos son muchos y su marido no le alcanza para esto. Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son ser una profesional.
texts.en:
Higuerón is very close to the city Portoviejo and surrounded by a lot of vegetation. Here many people work in farming and breeding animals, allowing them to help their families to move forward. The “San Antonio de Higuerón” loan group meets in this town every fortnight.

And it is here that 21-year-old Evelyn lives. She has a partner, a driver, but no children yet. Evelyn is studying at a further education establishment in the city.

Evelyn works very hard in order to earn her own income and improve her everyday family and work life. She makes a living selling Avon (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories) informally at her school. She also sells in the local area when she is free, usually three or four days per week.  Evelyn sells on credit and collects payments every week. Thanks to this work, to loans from Fundación Espoir, and to people who support her, Evelyn is able to achieve her dreams of having a profession and, in the future, providing the children she hopes to have with a better life.

Evelyn is applying for another loan so that she can take advantage of promotional offers at Avon and make a higher profit. Evelyn invests her profits in her education. Costs are high and her partner does not have enough money to support her with this. This loan will be used to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics and costume jewelry.

Evelyn has been with the loan group since its inception and she likes it because she receives loans. Evelyn’s dream is to have a profession.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en: Safina is a 55-year-old married woman with six grandchildren living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She used the previous loan to buy more cocoa to sell and managed to raise an income for her family. She has a vision of completing her residential house and educating her grandchildren to higher levels despite the challenge of competition and seasonality changes. Safina intends to use the loan to buy cocoa for resale.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa to sell

loans.name: Patricia Concepcion

texts.es:
Existen muchas personas perseverantes, luchadoras, que a pesar que las manecillas del reloj suenen más rápido en su vida, no dejan de soñar y cumplir sus metas. Ese es el caso de Patricia, una mujer de 47 años de edad, madre de tres hijos que han servido de inspiración durante su formación profesional. Esta soñadora está en cuarto año de la licenciatura de Química y Farmacia, carrera que está le gustó desde que era una niña, pero que no fue hasta poco que pudo estudiar.
Patricia cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es contador y le ha apoyado durante todos los años de su carrera. Ahora que está a punto de finalizar esta etapa importante en su vida, solicita un préstamo para pagar sus tutorías universitarias y así poder cerrar con este periodo que soñó desde hace mucho tiempo. Este curso le ayudará a obtener su título como licenciada Química y farmacéutica, por lo que sus oportunidades laborales incrementaran. En sus metas está conseguir un buen trabajo y culminar su pensum académico.
texts.en:
There are many people who are persevering and hard-working; people who, as time passes by quicker and quicker, don’t stop dreaming and achieving their goals. Patricia is one of those people: she is 47 years old and a mother to three children who have inspired her during her university studies. Patricia, a dreamer, is in fourth year of undergraduate studies in chemistry and pharmaceuticals. She has liked this subject since she was a girl but only recently could she begin to study it.

Patricia has the support of her husband, an accountant, who has supported her throughout her degree. Now that she is about to finish this important stage of her life, Patricia is applying for a loan in order to pay tuition fees and thus finish her degree, something that she has always dreamed of. This course will help Patricia to obtain her degree in chemistry and pharmaceuticals and her job opportunities will therefore increase. Amongst Patricia’s goals are to find a good job and complete her academic studies.

loans.use: to buy university tuition fees.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with five kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

Mwanajuma operates a vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the Kes 20,000, she wants to purchase two crates of vegetables, tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two crates of vegetables, tomatoes and onions for resale

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 73-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  He practices the rearing of cattle alongside owning rental houses where he gets his extra income. With this, he has been able to sustain his family. He hopes to expand his cattle farm and also complete his rental houses, however his main challenge is foot and mouth disease that attacks his cattle and inadequate capital.

He is requesting a loan to complete the construction of his rental houses.

loans.use: to complete the construction of his rental houses.

loans.name: Jeymil Junieth

texts.es:
Jeymil escuchaba cacarear las gallinas todas las mañanas desde que era pequeña, pues sus padres con mucho esfuerzo la sacaron adelante gracias a sus trabajos como ganaderos. Ahora las mañanas han cambiado para esta joven de 22 años de edad, quien en lugar de sentir el olor a tierra o pasto mojado, huele a medicamentos los pasillos de los hospitales donde trabaja y en la universidad donde lleva más de cinco años estudiando Enfermería.
La sonrisa reflejada en la cara de esta joven que busca ayudar a la sociedad, solo muestra una parte de la emoción que siente por estar a punto de finalizar su carrera universitaria. Jeymil siente que nada podrá detenerla para obtener su título por lo que solicita un crédito para pagar su curso de titulación y así graduarse como licenciada en Enfermería. En sus metas está seguir trabajando fuerte para ayudar a su familia, quien tanto le ha ayudado en su vida.
texts.en:
Jeymil used to hear hens cluck every morning when she was young. Her parents are farmers and have worked hard to help her make it in life. 

Nowadays, mornings are a little different for this 22 year old, who instead of smelling wet soil and grass, smells the medicines in the corridors of the hospitals where she works and in the university where she has been studying to be a nurse for more than 5 years. 

The smile on her face of this young woman who wants to help society only shows part of the emotion that she feels as she gets close to finishing her university degree.

Jeymil feels that nothing can get in the way of her getting her qualification which is why she is requesting the loan so she can pay for her degree and graduate as a qualified nurse. Her goals are to keep working hard to help her family who have helped her so much in life.

loans.use: To pay for her degree.

loans.name: Adriano

texts.es:
Adriano tiene 27 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y su hijo en el distrito de Pomahuaca que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio principalmente.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 8 años y con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de los vecinos de su distrito. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. Esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también a tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto, esto le generará mayores ingresos que le permitirán tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Adriano is 27 years old and lives in his own house made of rustic materials with his partner and their child in the Pomahuaca district which is located in the Jaen province of the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru. The inhabitants of this area mainly make a living in farming, breeding and commerce. 

Adriano makes a living as a coffee farmer and he has around 8 years of experience in the business, with good personal and professional references from the people in his district. 

He will use the loan he receives to carry out some farming work and to pay for the application and incorporation of phytosanitary products, fertilizers and labour for the harvest.This will help to improve his form, function and yield of his crop physiologically as well as producing a good harvest with a better quality product. Because of this he will easily be able to sell his product, making him better profit and, in turn, improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to carry out farming work and to pay for the application and incorporation of phytosanitary products, fertilizers and labour for the harvest.

loans.name: Hạnh

texts.en:
Hạnh works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle.

Hạnh is 63 years old, and he is married with 4 children. He lives and works in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hạnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Hạnh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hạnh faces in his life is not having money to build a latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

With his business profit, Hạnh hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, for his children to find a good job, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for his business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and sodas for his depot.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is married and has three children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has a beauty salon business from the market. She has been in this business for seven years, operating on a retail basis.

She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda Shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy hair relaxers, weaves, shampoo, treatments, and braids. Her major challenges includes electricity shortages in supply. 

Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land and to build a residential house. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy hair relaxers, weaves, shampoo, and braids

loans.name: Viflor

texts.en:
Viflor is 55 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

Viflor has been in this business for seven years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Melchorita

texts.en:
Melchorita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, coffee, noodles, eggs, etc. for her general store business.

Melchorita has been in this business for five years. Melchorita earns more income from selling dried fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Melchorita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, coffee, noodles, and eggs

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 27-year-old, hardworking married man with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in produce growing and selling. He also earns extra income from a retail shop. 

He is optimistic of having a big developed business and a big store for produce but has been limited by inadequate capital and weather changes. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more produce for his store to sell in the next season.

loans.use: to buy more produce for his store to sell in the next season.

loans.name: Mutuke

texts.en:
Mutuke is a male Ugandan, 26, who is married with two children who are six and two years old.

Mutuke is a boda boda cyclist but he also does mixed farming, though on a small scale. He is a resident of Bukungwe in Kagadi sub county.

He has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to complete payment of a motorcycle for his boda boda business. This, he believes, will increase his income.

His dream is to construct a good residential house for his family but he is quick to mention that he faces the challenge of fear due to increased motorcycle theft in the area.

He is hardworking and appreciates the support from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To top up his motorcycle payment

loans.name: Nzadze

texts.en:
Nzadze is a married woman with two kids, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Nzadze operates a vegetable selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kes 15,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over four years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and competition in her business.

With the 50,000 Kenya Shillings (KES), she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Gift

texts.en:
Gift lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children and both go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She operates a shop selling second-hand shoes. She has been in this business for the last 4 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT–SACCO to buy bales of second-hand shoes. Her major challenge includes seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build permanent business premises. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for milk production to enable her to educate her children and expand her business by increasing the amount of bread to supply to her customers.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 30 years old, is married to Claire and is blessed with three children. He has been a dairy farmer for the last 12 years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000 from the business.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Visionfund Kenya to buy a dairy cow and buy animal feed so as to increase milk production and satisfy the demand of his customers for milk supply.
 
He plans to use the gained profits to repay the loan and educate his children. His hopes are to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and animal feed so as to increase milk production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to aid in income gain so as to achieve his set desires.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production to enable him purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Sarah works hard to support her family.

She has a butcher shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pre-paid mobile load. Sarah is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional meat to sell in her butcher shop business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Sarah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat to sell.

loans.name: Osbert

texts.en:
Osbert is male and aged thirty years. He is married with three children, two of them go to school. He does secretarial work as his major source of  income. He gets additional income from selling agricultural produce  such as maize, beans and coffee. 

However, Osbert dreams of living in a well-furnished house. He would like to acquire money to buy construction materials such as cement and sand to plaster his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement and sand to plaster his house.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with four kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanajuma operates a butcher shop, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 


With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase goats for slaughter for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats for slaughter and resale.

loans.name: Leopolda

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Leopolda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from raising poultry.  Leopolda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to  buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, coffee, chips, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Leopolda has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, coffee, chips, etc.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a male who is 30 years old. He is single with no children. Julius lives in Kasese, Uganda. 

He used the previous loan to buy suit materials for sewing. He deals in men's clothes, especially suits- a business that has seen him grow and improve his standards of living. He has been in this business for 12 years. 

He is a hard working man who hopes to expand his business into a select shop dealing in executive suits only. Julius is acquiring a loan to buy textiles materials for making suits to sell.

loans.use: to buy textiles materials for making suits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and fodder for her dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Flora May

texts.en:
Flora May engages in a hog raising business. She is a 20-year-old woman with two young dependents. She is a resident in the town of  Talibon, Bohol. She has raised and sold pigs for two years already.  

She  is asking for a loan to buy a pig.  She will be able to raise and sell quality pigs. With this, she will be able to manage her finances and provide her children with healthy diets. Her children will have better living conditions.

Flora May is hoping she can improve her current sources of income to become more sustainable, and continue to provide the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy a pig

loans.name: Girivazio

texts.en:
Girivazio is a hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in cattle fattening as his main source of income, though he also practices farming to earn an extra income. He started this business with the intention of generating funds to meet personal goals. 

He hopes to expand his businesses and construct a permanent house, though he faces challenges of prolonged drought and lack of capital to meet the increasing demands.

He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Mulyangasu

texts.en:
Mulyangasu lives in Kasese, Uganda. He is a 42-year-old male, married with  three children. He has been teaching for 20 years. 

He also has the responsibility of educating his children in order to improve their standards of living. 

He is a honest person, requesting money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is a married woman and has five school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses for the family are food and school fees.

For the past three years she has operated a business of buying and selling livestock, selling at the market to local neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats and cows to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Teopister

texts.en:
Teopister is a 50-year-old hardworking lady with five children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a farmer, and at the same time a teacher, which adds more income for her. She is faced with a challenge of limited capital that hinder the progress of her business. 

She has asked for a loan to buy tomato herbicides for her tomato garden.

loans.use: to buy tomato herbicides for her tomoto garden

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a 33-year-old house agent and retail shop owner at Changamwe, Kenya. He is a married father of two children, and his wife provides additional income. He has done his business for the last two years, with enthusiasm.

This marks his first borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his retail business. 

He will use the loan to purchase a stock of sugar, tea leaves, milk and washing powder, and the anticipated profit to service his loan and educate his children. 

He hopes to prosper in his businesses in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, tea leaves, milk and washing powder

loans.name: Ezra

texts.en:
Ezra is a 36-year-old male, married with seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. Ezra deals in produce, selling and buying dry foods such as maize, beans, ground nuts, millet and many others. He is also a farmer, growing crops such as bananas, cotton and maize. 

Ezra is a hard working man with a dream of having a successful business and educating his children, however, he is faced with a challenge of transport and weather changes. 

Ezra wants money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable her to satisfy her customers' high demand for milk supply.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married mother of six children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past seven years, Chizi has operated a clothing sales business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation. Chizi dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

Chizi is requesting a loan to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Anzazi

texts.en:
Anzazi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to pay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Demna

texts.en:
Demna is 43 years old and from the Chkhorotsku district. He lives with his pensioner mother. 

Demna works at the local public school as a director, and gets a fixed salary. Apart of this, he has small agricultural activity, cultivating a family-owned land and harvesting kiwi. He has great desire to make his business more profitable and start dairy farming. 

The startup program, that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 3,500 GEL for purchasing a milk cow.  After the cow is purchased, the family will start producing dairy products: cheese and yogurt to sell. They will also use the milk products for family feeding. 

The loan will greatly assist Demna, and he will be able to improve his economic situation and give his family a better style of life.

loans.use: To start dairy farming and expand his agribusiness

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel, 22 years old, is married to Jane and they are blessed with 1 child, aged 2. Emmanuel has been rearing cattle for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 6,200. 

Emmanuel has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to educate his children and expand his farming activities. His plans are to use the profits to repay the loan and the remaining cash to pay school fees for his children. Emmanuel's hopes are to be financially stable, as well as rich.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to educate his children and expand his farming activities

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is a 62-year-old married woman with six grown children, living in Talibon, Bohol. She operates a tricycle transportation service, earning an income by the rent she imposes. Celsa also engages in rice farming. She has been in that business for more than 10 years.

Celsa is asking for a loan to pay for the franchise of the tricycle. This will enable her to continue to operate her business and augment her income. Celsa could now prepare nutritious diets and have better living conditions. She is hoping to improve her current business to become sustainable in the coming future.

loans.use: to pay for the franchise of the tricycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable her to increase daily milk production

loans.name: Carlos Gilberto

texts.es:
Un delicioso aroma a pan recién hecho sale del negocio de Carlos, un joven de veintiocho años de edad, que se dedica a hornear y vender, pasteles, reposterías y bocadillos. Él está muy contento, sobre todo agradecido con Kiva y MiCrédito, quienes confiaron en él y le otorgaron un primer préstamo para empezar su negocio en el mundo de la panadería. Con este logró salir adelante e iniciar a estudiar en la universidad, además de comprar una máquina para decorar pasteles y una cocina con horno. 
En estos momentos que su negocio está floreciendo, vuelve a recurrir a Kiva junto a MiCrédito, solicitando otro préstamo para abastecerse de su materia prima, es decir, harina, huevos, saborizantes, mantequilla, moldes, entre otros productos. Este crédito le servirá para producir más y así ahorrar. Su plan es comprar un motocicleta para hacer entregas a domicilio. En un futuro desea terminar su carrera universitaria además de ser un padre ejemplar para su pequeño hijo.
texts.en: A delicious aroma of recently baked bread comes out of Carlos' store. He is a young 28 year old man who works baking and selling cakes, baked goods and snacks. He is very happy, and specially very grateful to Kiva and MiCredito who trusted in him and gave him his first loan to start his business in the baking world. With it he was able to move ahead and start studying at the university, as well as buying a machine to decorate cakes and a kitchen with an oven. Currently, his business is flourishing, and he comes again to request another loan to Kiva and MiCredito in order to stock up with basic ingredients, such as flour, eggs, flavorings, butter, baking tins, among other products. This loan will be useful to produce more and be able to save. His plan is to buy a motorcycle so he can offer home delivery services. In the future, he wishes to finish his college career, and be an exemplary father for his small son.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, flavorings, butter, baking tins, among other products.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail butcher shop business for the past two years, selling goat meat. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and transportation.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats for slaughter and resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats for slaughter and resale.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Justus. He is 53 years old, married, and has four children. 

He is a poultry farmer. He has applied for a loan to buy poultry feeds and buy more chickens that will increase his production. He hopes that this will help him increase his income, which will help him improve his living standards and pay his children’s tuition fees.

He is happy with this loan and grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: To buy poultry feeds and chicken that will help improve production and therefore profitability.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is 55-year-old married woman from the village of Shilda. She lives with father-in-law and husband. 

Manana and her husband requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for an agricultural business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is her husband’s salary. He works as a private artisan and generates approximately 300 GEL. It is hardly enough for food for a three-member family. 

According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. Manana has requested a Credo loan for the start-up of an agricultural business. Her loan request was approved within the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Manana will place the purchased calves in an old cattle shed located in the family yard. She will raise them and, after 12 months, will start milking them. Manana will start production of cheese and she will sell it at the open market of the nearby town. As a result of the new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the income of the family will increase significantly. Manana will be able to create better living conditions for her family and will be very grateful for the help.

loans.use: To start agribusiness and purchase cattle.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa engages in the hog-raising business. She raises and sells hogs. She is a married woman with seven children. Four of her children are still attending school. She has been raising pigs for 8 years already.  

She is asking for a loan to buy pigs and purchase materials for pig pen renovation. She will be able to raise and sells healthy hogs. She will now have a good shelter for the pigs to live. Her income will slowly increase and enable her to manage her finances. She will then be able to provide healthy food to the whole family. She will be able to continue to finance the education of her children.

In the future, Nimfa dreams of expanding her business to make it more productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy pigs and purchase materials to renovate her pig pen.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose tiene 42 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y sus cinco menores hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de animales.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro de 6 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. Esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también a tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto lo cual le generará mayores ingresos que le permitirán llevar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is 42 years old, and lives in his own house of rustic materials along with his wife and their five small children.  They live in the Pomahuaca district which is located in the Jaén province of the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Perú.  The inhabitants of this district make a living in agriculture, livestock, and raising animals.

Jose makes a living in agriculture, specifically by growing coffee.  He has six years of experience in this field.  The loan that will be granted to him will be used in his agricultural work to pay for the application and incorporation of pesticides, to buy fertilizers, and to pay for labor for his harvest.  This will help him improve the physiology, morphology, and productivity of his crops.  It will also allow him to have a timely harvest, greater production, a higher quality product, and thus enable him to sell his product without any trouble.  This will generate a higher income that will allow him to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for the application and incorporation of pesticides, to buy fertilizers, and to pay for labor for his harvest.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region of Armenia. She has been a teacher for eight years and currently is teaching secondary classes. Margarita says she greatly enjoys her work with children. She also helps some of her students after school at her house to complete their homework and she very patiently explains anything that may be unclear from their lessons. Margarita is married and she lives with her husband and mother-in law. This loan of 250,000 Armenian drams (AMD) will allow her to buy a computer, through which she can make her private courses more interesting, informative and enjoyable for her students.

loans.use: to buy a computer for tutoring

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann, 43, engages in running a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic commodities like noodles, canned goods, soap, cooking oil, biscuits and seasonings. She is a married woman with no dependents. It has been almost four years that she has been running a store. She hails from Talibon, Bohol.

She is asking for a loan to buy more assorted stocks for the store. These will fill her store and attract more buyers. With these, she will be able earn higher income so that she can handle her finances.

 In the future, Mary Ann hopes to expand her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more assorted stocks for the store.

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
Sona is a 28-year-old lady who lives in Stepanavan city of the Lori region. Sona has vocational education and for five years she worked at the beauty salon as a hairdresser. But the last three years she has managed her small business at her house. She makes cakes of unbelievable beauty for different occasions such as birthday parties, weddings and various corporate events. She bakes very tasty and cute cakes so that she has more and more regular customers. She also takes orders from the markets. 

Sona is married and she perfectly manages her business and takes care of her two children. Sona’s husband is a contractual military serviceman. Sona wants to renew her style of cake decoration and for that she wants to buy new equipment for decoration and she also wants to buy a bigger refrigerator, since with enlarging her business she needs more space for keeping the products always fresh. 

For these purchases she needs this Kiva loan in an amount of 300,000 Armenian drams. She hopes that through it she will develop and enlarge her business.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for cake decoration and also a bigger refrigerator.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail butcher shop for the past two years, selling goat meat to the neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge with transportation to her place of business.
With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase a stock of goats to resell the meat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats to resell the meat.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña María es una mujer alegre y emprendedora, empieza su día limpiando su mesa de trabajo y encendiendo su cocina de leña, para luego dar inicio a la preparación de sus deliciosos nacatamales, los cuales vende al calor de las tortillas recién hechas que también ofrece a sus clientes. Ella está muy agradecida porque antes ya había sido beneficiada con un préstamo de Kiva y MiCrédito, el cual utilizó para comprar maíz, leña, tomates, carne, cebollas, chiltomas, entre otros ingredientes que utiliza a diario en la preparación de su comida. 
Ahora esta trabajadora mujer, vuelve a depositar su esperanza en Kiva junto a MiCrédito esperando se le otorgue otro préstamo para comprar los ingredientes que utiliza para cocinar su deliciosa comida. Así mismo para comprar una cocina industrial que le permitirá realizar más nacatamales y tortillas. Esto le traerá además del ahorro de tiempo en su trabajo, conseguirá dedicar más tiempo a sus cuatro hijos. Para María cada día es una oportunidad de crecer como comerciante, movida por las ganas de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia se dedica en cuerpo  y alma a su negocio.
texts.en:
Doña María is a cheerful and entrepreneurial women. She begins her day cleaning her desk and lighting her wood stove, then she begins the preparation of her delicious tamales, which she sells in hot tortillas that she also offers her customers. She is very thankful because before she had already benefited from a loan from Kiva and MiCrédito, which she used to buy corn, firewood, tomatoes, meat, onions, green peppers, among other ingredients that she uses daily to prepare her food.

Now this working woman returns to put her hope in Kiva along with MiCrédito hoping to be granted another loan to buy the ingredients that she uses to cook her delicious food. Also to buy an industrial kitchen which will allow her to make more tamales and tortillas. This will also bring savings of time at work, so she will get to devote more time to her four children. For María every day is an opportunity to grow as a merchant. She is devoted in body and soul to her business and is moved by the desire to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy an industrial kitchen, corn, firewood, tomatoes, meat, onions, and green peppers, among other products.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush lives with her nice family in Vanadzor city of the Lori region. She is married and she is a mother of two boys. Both of them are school-aged and her smaller son is greatly interested in karate. He already has a lot of successes in this sport as he very often takes part in different competitions. 

Anush’s husband is a contractual military serviceman. Anush has higher pedagogical education and she is a specialist of chemistry and biology. Already for 20 years she has worked at the school as a teacher of chemistry.  She says her subject demands great attention and concentration and during her lessons very skillfully she manages to attract the pupils’ attention on the theme and keeps them active during the whole lesson. She also gives paid private courses of chemistry at her house and helps pupils to get prepared for the entrance examinations. 

She needs this Kiva loan of 350,000 Armenian drams as she wants to buy a computer and professional literature for her courses at home, as she wants to make it more informative and interesting, so that her pupils will receive more knowledge and more information from the subject during their lessons.

loans.use: to buy a computer and professional literature for her courses at home.

loans.name: Kajik

texts.en:
Kajik is 34 years old and he lives in the frontier village Gandzakar of Tavush region. Kajik is married and he has two school-aged children. Kajik, with his beloved wife, perfectly manages farming and agriculture. His plot of land gives harvests of potatoes and beans, fruits such as persimmon, apples, nuts and figs. All these are both for sale and for their family's use.
