Kajik’s farm is cute, but has great chances to become larger, since his cattle barn is rather big and he can keep there a lot of cattle. Currently, in his farm Kajik has two cows, a pig and 15 chickens. He sells his farm’s milk and eggs mainly to his neighbors. Kajik says he will be greatly thankful if Kiva lenders will be so kind to help him with the loan amount, which he plans to spend on the purchase of piglets to develop swine breeding and also animal fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy piglets to develop swine breeding and also animal fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.name: Yasser Amin

texts.es:
Lleno de voluntad por ayudar a los demás, Yasser es estudiante de la carrera de trabajo social. Impulsado por sus padres, este carismático joven, pone todo su esfuerzo en sus estudios. Él desea ser un profesional de éxito, además de retribuirle a sus padres todo el sacrificio que han hecho por él. 
En estos momentos de su carrera, Yasser necesita una computadora portátil para hacer sus trabajos con mejor calidad. Es por eso que él solicita un préstamo a Kiva junto a MiCrédito, para adquirir ese dispositivo tecnológico tan útil para un estudiante en la actualidad. El gran sueño de este joven es coronar su licenciatura con honores, insertarse en el mundo laboral y estudiar lo más que pueda.
texts.en:
Yasser is a student studying social work, and he is full of the good will to help others.  Driven by his parents, this charismatic young man puts all of his effort into his studies.  He wishes to be a successful professional in addition to paying his parents back for all of the sacrifices they have made for him.

At this time in his studies Yasser needs a laptop computer to do his work with better quality.  That is why he is requesting a loan from Kiva together with MiCrédito to get this technological device, which is currently so useful to students.

This young man’s big dream is to top off his degree with honors, to enter the work world, and to study as much as he can.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer.

loans.name: Julito

texts.en:
Julito earns a living by operating an eatery. He sells home meals like fish soup, chicken adobo, stewed vegetables and many others. He is 50 year old  married man with three dependents aged 21, 20 and 16 years old respectively. Together with his family he lives in Talibon, Bohol.

He is asking for a loan to buy supplies like meat and vegetables for his business. These ingredients will be used in preparing variety of meals. He could then attract more customers and would be able to pay his obligations. He could also continue to finance the schooling of his children and provide their basic needs. 

 Julito would like  to expand his current business to make it productive and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy supplies like meat and vegetables to prepare meals for sale

loans.name: Gor

texts.en:
Gor is 33 years old and he lives with his mother in the village Geghamavan of Gegharkunik region. Gor used to work at different construction companies, but now he is engaged only in farming and agriculture. He has a rather rich farm where he takes care of cows, calves, heifers, a bull, pigs, sheep and chickens. With the help of his mother Gor sells his farm products such as milk, macun (a national dairy product), cheese (made by his mother), meat (pork, mutton and beef) and eggs. His customers are mainly butchers for the city and the owners of food markets.

His plot of land is also plenteous and he cultivates on it potato, greens, tomato, cucumber, fruits such as apple, fig, peach and strawberry. All these he sells to re-sellers. Gor says he does his best to develop his farm and provide good living conditions to his lovely mother.

This loan of 600,000 Armenian drams Gor asks as he wants to buy a lot of animal fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a lot of animal fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Dariko

texts.en:
Dariko sends her thanks and best wishes to Kiva lenders and hopes that her second deal with Kiva will also be successful. 

She lives in Sevan city in Gegharkunik region with his husband and daughter. Her son is still in abroad. Dariko works at the school as the deputy director of it, where many years she used to work as a teacher of mathematics. 

Dariko’s daughter still studies at the Yerevan State Medical University at the paid division and Dariko again needs Kiva support. This loan she asks as she must pay for her daughter’s tuition fee for the second semester. She is thankful beforehand for supporting her in a period of financial difficulties that her family has now.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s tuition fee for the second semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable him to meet his customers' high demand for milk every day mornings and evenings.

loans.name: Serob

texts.en:
This young man is 22 years old and he lives with his parents and his brother in the frontier village of Getahovit of the Tavush region. His name is Serob. Serob’s father is a constructor, his mother is a housewife and Serob’s brother is a student. 

Since his very young age, Serob has liked farming and now he has great plans connected with it. His farm cattle he keeps in a barn built of his own. He has a cow, four pigs and 20 chickens in the farm. His land is also not poor and it gives harvests of vegetables and fruits (potatoes, beans, cucumbers, greens also apple, persimmon, nuts, figs and plums). All his farm products he sells at the city’s wholesale market during the week. 

As in his family he is the person most interested in farming who does it with greatest pleasure, he  wants to make it bigger and richer with cattle. In order to develop swine breeding, with this Kiva loan he wants to buy piglets and also animal fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy piglets and also animal fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over two years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perish-ability leading to losses.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Yerald Domingo

texts.es:
Yerald es un hombre de treinta seis años de edad, que ama vivir en el campo. A diario cuida de sus cultivos de maíz y frijol, para luego cosecharlos y almacenarlos para venderlos en tiempo de escases, con lo cual obtiene mejores ganancias. También posee vacas, las cuales ordeña para luego comercializar su leche. Este emprendedor hombre, ya ha sido beneficiado con un primer préstamo de Kiva y MiCrédito, con el que mejoró los cercos de su potrero, manteniendo a su ganado bovino seguro.
A medida que pasa el tiempo, su cerco se ha ido deteriorando por lo que sus animales están expuestos a escaparse o ser robados. Por esta razón es que vuelve a solicitar un crédito para poder comprar alambre, madera, grapas y contratar mano de obra. De esta manera va a reforzar la seguridad de su fuente de trabajo. Yerald lucha día a día por ser mejor y sacar a su familia adelante, en un futuro planea comprar más tierra para cultivar otros productos.
texts.en:
Yerald, age 36, loves living in the country.  He cares for his corn and bean crops daily so that he can later harvest them, store them, and sell them during times when they are scarce.  By doing so he gets better earnings.  He also has cows that he milks and then sells the milk.   This enterprising man has benefited from his first loan from Kiva and MiCrédito.  He used it to improve his pasture fences, keeping his livestock secure. 

As time passed, his fence has deteriorated, and the animals are at risk of getting out or being robbed.  This is the reason that he returns to request a loan to be able to buy wire, wood, and staples and to pay for labor.  This way he will reinforce the security of his source of work.  

Yerald struggles day to day in order to improve himself and to get his family ahead.  In the future he plans to buy more land in order to cultivate other products.

loans.use: to buy wire, wood, and staples and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
40 year-old Naira was born in Nor Armavir village, Armavir region. 
She is married and has two children, a son and daughter. 
Her son is 21 years old and her daughter is 13 years old. 
Naira works at a local secondary school as a teacher and together with her husband also runs their family farm. 
The farm includes cows, sheep, chickens and arable land where a large variety of vegetables and fruits are grown. 
Both Naira and her husband work hard to run their farm successfully and together they've managed to enrich it. 
By applying for this loan, Naira would like to purchase fertilizer, pesticide, land cultivation, a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse and hire workers for harvesting work. This is Naira's second loan, which has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, pesticide, land cultivation, polyethylene cover for the greenhouse and hire workers for harvesting works

loans.name: Drita

texts.en:
Drita is a married mother of two, 26 and 21, and she wants to buy potato seeds for planting, with your financial help; the season has already started. 
Drita has been doing agriculture/livestock for about 10 years and this has been her only source of income. She has about 20 dynyms (2 hectares) of agricultural land where she plants potatoes, beans and corn. The remaining 3 dynyms she has given to a very poor family to plant for themselves. She sells the fresh products to buyers. In addition to planting, she’s got a cow as well from which she sells milk most of the year, 10 liters/day at a price of $100/total.
Drita is been photographed inside the animal stable.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds for seasonal planting

loans.name: Kamaha Tutungukye Group

texts.en: The only lady in the group photo is called Annah, a widow and a single mother with 5 children, all of whom go to school.This lady owns a retail shop at omukagana trading centre, which is her source of income. However she is challenged by limited capital, so she decided to join Ugafode for financial assistance. She applied for a loan of 500,000 shillings in order to add more stock, in particular jerrycans of cooking oil, rice, millet flour, sugar, soap, and detergents, for her retail business. She believes that her income will increase, her children will go to school and she will also earn a living after adding more capital to her business. She is grateful to Kiva lenders for the financial support rendered to her and her colleagues in Kahama tutungukye group. They also thank Ugafode for financial assistance, which will  help to improve their standards of living.

loans.use: To buy retail stock to resell

loans.name: Bardhyl

texts.en:
Bardhyl does agriculture for a living and wants now to buy a dairy cow since he’s got none so far and he is expecting soon to become a father. He is married and is a member of the Egyptian Albanian community living in the Korca region known for the largest production of potatoes, beans, wheat and corn, rye, chickpeas and oats and also bell peppers.  

Bardhyl’s family owns some agricultural land of about 28 dynym; he plants corn, wheat and beans in 19 dynyms and the other nine have been rented out to other villagers. Other income in the family is his father’s retirement pension of approximately $127/month.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow since his family will be growing soon

loans.name: Mamerta

texts.en:
Mamerta is engaged in making pots.  She makes and sells pots to the locals in her area. She is a 60 year-old widow residing in Talibon, Bohol. She has an eighteen year old daughter. She has been engaged in the pottery business for more than 10 years .

She has requested  for a loan to buy materials like clay and cement. These materials  will be used in making pots and allow her to cater to the orders of her respective customers. With these purchases her income will be augmented and she will be able to provide a healthy diet for her and her daughter. Her child will continue her schooling and she will be able to attend to her basic needs. 
 Mamerta  dreams of expanding her business to make it sustainable for the future.

loans.use: to buy materials like clay and cement

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 04 hijos en una zona rural ubicada en el distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Las actividades principales de este distrito son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercio de ganado vacuno, cuenta con invernas propias para el pasteo de sus animales, cuenta con más de 08 años de experiencia en el rubro y con clientes fijos quienes dan muy buenas referencias de el. Adicionalmente Cesar se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte. El préstamo será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ganado vacuno, así como para realizar reparaciones del lugar donde los cría, con esto Cesar espera mejorar su negocio lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en sus ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cesar is 37 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner and their four children. They live in a rural area in the Pomahuaca district in Jaen Province, Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Peru. Most people in this region engage in agriculture, commerce and cattle raising.

Cesar raises and sells cattle and has his own pastures for grazing his animals. He has eight years of experience in this field and has regular customers who speak very highly of him. In addition, Cesar provides transportation services.

The loan will be to purchase more cattle and to perform repairs on the place where he raises them. This will enable Cesar to improve his business which will have a positive impact on his income and, ultimately, his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more cattle and to make repairs to the place where he raises them.

loans.name: Jose Benjamin

texts.es:
Jose tiene 45 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 1 hijo, vive con su familia en el distrito de Nueva Arica una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales principalmente.

El se dedica a brindar servicios agrícolas como peón, contando con herramientas propias de trabajo, cuenta con más de 3 años de experiencia en el negocio, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Nueva Arica. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más herramientas de trabajo para implementar su negocio así como para brindar mantenimiento a sus actuales herramientas ya que se encuentran en mal estado, con esto Jose espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is 45 years old, is in a common-law relationship and has one child. He lives with his family in the district of Nueva Arica which is located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the North Coast of Peru. Life in his community is quiet and the people work principally in agriculture and raising animals.

Jose works offering agricultural services as a laborer. He has his own work tools and he has more than 3 years of experience in the business. His business is located in the district of Nueva Arica. He is requesting loan to buy more work tools to carry out his business as well as doing maintenance on his existing tools as they are in poor condition. Doing this Jose hopes to offer better service to his clients which will allow him to increase his income and improve his quality of living.

loans.use: to buy more work tools and to do maintenance on his existing tools as they are in poor condition.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for hoeing and fertiliser

loans.name: Faaituala

texts.en:
Faaituala is a 47 year old mother with 7 children.

She runs a business selling fish at the market to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Faaituala has requested a loan to buy a fishing net, boat, ice bags, containers and fishing gear to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's daily needs.

Faaituala joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, boat, ice bags, containers and fishing gear.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
Claudio tiene 54 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge y sus dos hijas, vive en casa propia de material rústico en una comunidad pequeña dedicada básicamente a la agricultura y ganadería, se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y posterior comercialización de ganado vacuno, cría en inverna propia con pasto natural de la zona, se dedica a esta actividad hace 15 años, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Adicionalmente se dedica a a cultivar café variedad catimore, yuca, menestras, entre otros, lo que le genera mayores ingresos para poder solventar el crédito. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ganado vacuno para engordarlo y luego venderlo, con esto Claudio espera obtener mayores ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Claudio is 54 years old. He has a stable household along with his spouse and two children. They live in their own house made of rustic materials in a small community basically devoted to agriculture and raising livestock. it is located in the district of Santo Tomás, in the province of Cutervo, Cajamarca region, in the North Andes of Peru.

Claudio works raising and later selling cattle. He raises them on his own natural grass pasture land in the area. He Has been doing this for 15 years and has a lot of experience in the field and has good personal and work references from his district. Additionally he works growing Catimore varietal coffee, yucca, legumes, amongst others with which he generates more income to help pay off the loan. The loan will be used to buy a greater quantity of cattle to fatten and then sell. doing this Claudio hopes to obtain greater income and in the end improve his quality of living and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of cattle to fatten and then sell.

loans.name: Irabitanga Group

texts.fr:
M Goreth fait partie du groupe  Irabitanga et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 38 ans et est mariée à Jean, un maçon. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant âgé de 17ans, qui étudie. 

Elle fait le commerce du riz, de la  farine, du haricot,...  depuis  20 ans. 

Elle est son à  dix-huitième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité  de riz,  de farine, et de haricot  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter une parcelle  à Gitega centre, et voir son enfant étudier.
texts.en: Madam Goreth is a member of the Irabitanga group and lives in Gitega. She is 38 years old and married to a carpenter called Jean. They have one 17 year old child together, who is studying. Madam Goreth has made a living in rice, flour and beans for twenty years. She is on her 18th loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that she will receive, she will boost her working capital and purchase a large quantity of rice, flour and beans in order to sell and drive profits. In the years to come, she would like to purchase a plot of land in Gitega centre, and support her child's studies.

loans.use: to boost her working capital and purchase a large quantity of rice, flour and beans, to re-sell in order to generate profits

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children; three go to school. She has one additional family member. She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last two years. She works seven days a week. 

Teddy has requested a loan of UGX 400,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build more rental houses. She lives in her own house but the family has no access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Ahouefa

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 38 ans, Ahouefa est une femme mère d’un seul enfant. Ahouefa habite à Amadahomé et vend des chaussures en se promenant dans le quartier afin d’avoir le bénéfice nécessaire pour leur épanouissement. Pour arriver à ses fins, Ahouefa s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché local de Lomé. Pour commander des cartons de chaussures, Ahouefa demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et disposer d’un revenu afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de leur enfant
texts.en: Ahouefa is a 38 year old married mother of one. She lives in Amadahomé and sells shoes for a living, walking around her quarter in order to make her sales. To achieve this she procures her goods twice a month from the Lomé local market. To order these boxes of shoes, Ahouefa is seeking a loan in order to procure her goods and generate a revenue so that she may help her husband with their child's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase there boxes of shoes

loans.name: Egnonam

texts.fr: Egnonam, âgée de 37 ans est une femme divorcée et vit à Adamavo avec ses trois enfants. Egnonam vend des produits d’alimentations générales en se promenant dans les marchés et dans les quartiers environnant pour fournir ses clients. Pour avoir un stock toujours disponible, Egnonam s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Egnonam a le désir d’acheter quelque sac de piment et d’oignons pour équiper son étagère et nécessite ce fonds pour réaliser son achat afin avoir une rentabilité lui permettant de soutenir les charges de sa famille.
texts.en: Egnonam is a 37 year-old divorcee and lives in Adamavo with her three children. She sells general foodstuffs, walking through markets and surrounding areas in order to serve her customers. So that she may always have available stock, she sources her goods twice a month from the market. She would like to buy several bags of pepper and onions in order to prepare her stall, and is seeking this loan in order to finalise this purchase. This way she will be able to achieve profitability which will enable her to see to her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase a bag of pepper and two bags of onions

loans.name: Akpédzé

texts.fr: Agée de 33 ans, Akpédzé est une femme mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Akpédzé vit à Gblinkomégan dans un quartier de Lomé avec son enfant et elle travaille vigoureusement pour améliorer ses conditions de vie. Pour arriver à ses fins, Akpédzé vend des produits d’alimentations générales pour gagner assez de bénéfices et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Akpédzé désire ce microcrédit pour financer l’achat de sacs de riz et des pommes de terre  afin d’aider ses enfants à avoir une bonne éducation scolaire grâce au bénéfice trouvé.
texts.en: Akpédzé is a 33 year old married mother of four. She lives in Gblinkomégan, in a quarter of Lomé, with her child. She works tirelessly in order to improve her standard of living. She makes her living selling general foodstuffs and procures her goods twice a month at the market. She is seeking this loan in order to finance the purchase of bags of rice and potatoes. She would like to boost profits in order to help her children to receive a good education.

loans.use: to purchase 4 bags of rice and 5 bags of potatoes

loans.name: Ibtissam

texts.en:
Ibtissam is a 49-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children. She’s the main provider in family and the one taking care of her children and providing for their needs. Due to her difficult financial situation, Ibtissam opened a library and toy shop in her town in 2003.

Ibtissam is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to renovate her shop and buy additional stationary. She will use her loan to enlarge her shop and better develop her job. In that way, Ibtissam will be able to attract more clients and surely earn higher revenues. She hopes to improve her family’s way of living. Ibtissam's face is blurred in this picture.

loans.use: to renovate her shop and buy stationary

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Nilo

texts.es:
Nilo tiene 47 años de edad, es soltero, vive en el distrito de Pomahuaca que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Las actividades principales de este distrito son la agricultura, crianza de animales y comercio.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en el distrito de Pomahuaca y zonas cercanas, cuenta con una mototaxi propia con la cual brinda este servicio, cuenta con más de 05 años de experiencia en el rubro y con clientes fijos quienes dan buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de cuyes con una experiencia de 3 años en este negocio. El destino del crédito será para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Nilo espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que se verá reflejado en mayores ingresos que le permitirán mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Nilo is 47 years old. He lives in the district of Pomahuaca which is located in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca region in the North Andes of Peru.

He offers transportation services in the district of Pomahuaca and the neighboring areas. He has his own motorcycle taxi which he uses to provide his services. He has more than 5 years experience in the field and has regular clients who can give him good personal and work references. He also works raising and selling guinea pigs and has 3 years experience in this field. The loan will be used to do repairs and maintenance on his vehicle which is currently in poor condition. Doing this Nilo hopes to offer better service to his clients which will be reflected in greater income which will allow him to improve his quality of living and that of his family.

loans.use: to do repairs and maintenance on his vehicle as it is currently in poor condition.

loans.name: Kanga

texts.en:
Kanga is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. For the past three years, she has operated a business selling mobile phones in the market. Theft is her major business challenge. Kanga lives in her own house without electricity or running water. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

Kanga is requesting a loan to purchase mobile phones to resell.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to do weeding and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Celestine

texts.fr: Etant une femme au foyer et agée de 42 ans, Celestine vit avec ses quatre enfants dans le quartier Adamavo à Lomé. Celestine  vend des légumes pour ainsi subvenir aux besoins du foyer. Celestine s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé deux fois par semaine. Celestine est dynamique et a une bonne rentabilité dans son activité génératrice de revenu. Celestine  sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des paniers de légumes et réaliser encore plus de bénéfice.
texts.en:
As the woman of the house, aged 42, Celestine lives with her four children in the neighborhood called Adamavo in Lomé. Celestine  sells vegetables so as to cover the needs of the household. She buys her wares at the Grand Market of Lomé twice a week. 

 Celestine is hard-working and her money-earning business is profitable. She is requesting this loan to buy some baskets of vegetables and make even more profit.

loans.use: to buy some baskets of vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for mineral fertiliser, hoeing and harvesting

loans.name: Succès Ps Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Succès PS regroupe des femmes battantes qui font toutes le commerce. Ce groupe est à son 4ème contrat de prêt avec ACFIME et jusqu'ici, il respecte ces engagements en faisant les remboursements à la bonne date. Karidja, membre représentatif est mariée et fait le commerce des pagnes et des bazins. Cette brave dame a commencé ce commerce avant même son mariage et cela fait 10 ans maintenant. Elle a besoin du crédit pour acheter assez de pagnes et de bazins pour vendre à ses clients. A l'issue des ventes, son bénéfice lui permettra de continuer son activité et de pourvoir à ses petits besoins.
texts.en: The Succès PS group brings together strong ladies who all sell goods for a living. This group is on its fourth loan with ACFIME and up until now they have respected the repayment timings on their previous loans. Karidja is their leader - she is married and sells pagnes (wax cloths) and bazins (fabric). This impressive lady started in this field even before she was married; this was over 10 years ago. She is seeking a loan in order to purchase pagnes (wax cloths) and bazins in order to sell to her customers. The profits that she generates will enable her to continue to grow her business and to see to her modest needs.

loans.use: to purchase (wax cloths) and bazins (fabric) for re-sale

loans.name: Hoda

texts.en:
Hoda is a 34-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children. Her children attend school. In 1995, in order to supplement the family’s income, Hoda decided to start her own work as a farmer. She cooperates with her husband, who also works as an employee in a company, to provide for their family’s needs. 

Hoda is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase an agricultural tent. Her loan will surely help her increase her business productivity and result in higher profits. In the future, Hoda plans to take more Kiva loans and better develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase an agricultural tent

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bazin (a sort of damask cloth)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ingredients for the sale of cooked food

loans.name: Franchesca

texts.fr:
Francesca es una joven estudiante de medicina, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia: Soy Franchesca, tengo 29 años de edad, nací en San Juan de la Maguana  ciudad ubicada en el sur de la Republica Dominicana y actualmente resido en Santo Domingo. Soy la cuarta de seis hermanos y vivo con mi madre que labora como conserje en una escuela  pública y mi padre falleció hace justamente 4 meses.
Tengo la intención de seguir estudiando mi carrera de medicina en la universidad Autónoma de Santo Domingo, Pero por razones económicas y por la enfermedad que padeció mi padre no he podido avanzar. La razón por la cual estoy solicitando el préstamo educativo es para continuar con mis estudios, porque los ingresos de mi madre no son suficientes para costear la universidad y sustentar mi familia. 
Es mi anhelo convertirme en una gran doctora graduarme con notas excelentes y así aplicar residencia en cirugía cardiovascular que es el área en la que pienso especializarme, ya sea para laborar en el sector público o privado, luego después de todo darme la oportunidad de tener mi familia y obviamente cumplir con la responsabilidades frente a la sociedad.
Agradezco de antemano su recepción esperando ser favorecida bien esta solicitud y que de no recibir este préstamo no podría salir adelante como en verdad deseo, lo que me provocaría un estancamiento y la perdida de oportunidades que si tengo la ayuda de ustedes la puedo aprovechar.
texts.en:
Franchesca is a young Medical student. She is requesting a loan to be able to pay her educational expenses and this is her story:

"I am Franchesca. I am 29 years old. I was born in San Juan de la Maguana, a city located in the south of the Dominican Republic and I currently reside in Santo Domingo. I am the fourth of 6 siblings and live with my mother who works as a caretaker in a public school. My father passed away 4 months ago.

I intend to continue studying medicine at the universidad Autónoma de Santo Domingo but for economic reasons and because of the illness that my father suffered I could not advance. The reason that I am applying for this educational loan is to continue my studies. My mother's income is not sufficient to pay for university and support my family.

It is my dream to become a great doctor graduating with high marks and apply to do my residency in heart surgery which is the area I am thinking of specializing either working in the public or private sector. Later after all this it will give me the opportunity to have my family and obviously fulfill my responsibilities to society.

I thank in advance your hopefully favorable reception to this request as not to receive this loan I will not be able to get ahead as I truly wish. This would produce a stalemate and the loss of opportunity that I will have if you approve my loan".

loans.use: to pay higher education expenses.

loans.name: Rached

texts.en:
Rached is a 37-year-old single, Lebanese man. He lives with his parents and three siblings who are not working. Rached cooperates with his father to enhance their family’s financial situation. He struggles to work really hard and doesn't hesitate to offer help whenever needed. 

In 2013, he decided to start his own business and opened a grocery store. He is a very welcoming and friendly person. He is well-known in his town to have a good reputation. Today, he wants to borrow a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy a refrigerator and expand his store. 

He is very positive about his future and wishes to improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and expand his grocery store.

loans.name: Lynnie

texts.en:
As a married parent of children, Lynnie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Lynnie is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, rice, sugar, etc., to sell for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lynnie has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, rice, sugar, etc., to sell

loans.name: Mchenyumba

texts.en:
Mchenyumba is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over 14 years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from her home to her neighbours and passersbys. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is from Shenik village where she lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and two grandsons. 

Now, with her lovely husband, Anahit takes care of the farm, which is a rather rich one: cows, calves, a heifer, a pig, and piglets. In order to have a greater and richer farm, Anahit and her husband work hard. Anahit now asks for this loan of 700 USD to purchase livestock feed and seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation. 

Anahit greatly hopes that Kiva lenders will help her family in their steps towards developing their farm.

As this is Anahit's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. This first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn't previously have access to credit products because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for livestock feed, and seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel es una mujer 22 años, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 hijo varón de 1 año y una hija mujer de 3 meses, y su negocio es la venta de papa.
Ella es emprendedora, buena madre, independiente, activa, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla de forma ambulante en la localidad de Sacaba, un área rural donde las mayoría de las construcciones son rústicas y dónde llega la producción del campo como frutas, verduras y también carne, de clima templado, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 9-24 grados centígrados.
Maribel es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa estilo cola de caballo, ojos pardos, baja estatura,  complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al comercio de verdura y con sus hijos que son bebés, viven en una casa propia que se encuentra sin finalizar de construir hecha de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua de pozo y energía eléctrica. Para extraer el agua se debe encender la bomba eléctrica, y extrae el líquido desde las profundidades, esta agua no es limpia y sale sucia color tierra, para beberla se la debe hervir y dejar reposar hasta que la tierra asiente en el fondo del recipiente. “necesito instalar agua potable en mi casa, para que mis hijos vivan en mejores condiciones…” comenta. Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa, ella desea realizar la instalación de agua potable, en su cocina, baño y lavandería para que sus hijos crezcan en un hogar seguro. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que construye su casa.
Es por esos motivos que Maribel solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable, en su cocina, baño y lavandería para que sus hijos crezcan en un hogar seguro.
texts.en:
Maribel is a 22 year-old woman who lives with her partner.  She has a 1 year-old son and a 3 month-old baby girl.  Maribel has a business selling potatoes.  She is enterprising, a good mother, independent, active, responsible, and hardworking.  Maribel is developing her business by selling from place to place in the town of Sacaba.  This is a rural area where most of the construction is rudimentary, and where farming of fruits and vegetables is common, as well as livestock production.  This area has a temperate climate, with a daytime temperature that varies between 9 and 24 degrees centigrade.

Maribel has a dark complexion and long black hair that she wears in a ponytail. She has brown eyes, a short stature, and a slim build.  Her native language is Quechua, which she speaks in her home, and she also speaks Spanish in everyday life and in her business.  She shares her life with her partner, who works selling vegetables, and her two babies.  They live in their own home, which is not completely built, and is made of bricks and cement with a tin roof.  They have well water and electricity.  To extract the water they have to turn on the electric pump and pull the liquid up from the depths.  This water is not clean, and comes out earth-colored.  In order to drink it, it must be boiled and left to stand until the dirt settles at the bottom of the container.  "I need to install potable water in my home so that my children can live in better conditions," she comments.  Her dream is to finish the construction of their house,  and install potable water in their kitchen, bathroom, and laundry area so that her children can grow up in a safe house.

loans.use: to install safe drinking water in her home

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old. She owns and operates a small business selling cabbages, cucumbers, eggplants and coconut drinks in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Josephine has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage, cucumber, eggplant), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel and chemicals to help her with the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

Josephine joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage, cucumber, eggplant), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel and chemicals.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is responsible for 2 children and his mute wife. He is a tenant of some agricultural land with root crops and pineapple.

Because Jimmy is a trusted tenant, serving the landowner for 25 years cultivating the land, the landowner is selling the land to Jimmy on an installment basis. This is the opportunity Jimmy has been waiting for. He is applying for his second cycle loan from Paglaum amounting to 50,000 PHP to pay the down payment on half a hectare of agricultural land.

Jimmy is hoping that God continues bless his plants so that he can continue to save for emergencies and support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to pay the down payment on half a hectare of land.

loans.name: Dorcus

texts.en:
Dorcus is a 42 year old Ugandan lady. She is a widow with 4 children aged 19, 15, 12, and 9, who all go to school.

Dorcus is a business-lady who deals in the sale of cosmetics in a Trading Centre in the Hoima district. She also carries out farming though on a small scale. Dorcus has a large customer base for her cosmetics but has time and again been faced with the challenge of limited capital. This time she is seeking a financial boost from UGAFODE to buy more of the items in high demand from her customers. She is hopeful she will make profits on the sales.

She appreciates UGAFODE and Kiva lenders for empowering women. Her dream is to expand her business and educate all her children and see them finish school.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: pay for labor for maintenance and harvesting.

loans.name: Kenzhegul

texts.ru: Кенжегул 36 лет, замужем, есть 3 детей. Образование средне-специальное, Кенжегул уже 7 лет занимается торговлей продуктами питания, в обороте есть товар на сумму 150,000 сом (KGS). Дополнительно Кенжегул занимается животноводством, в хозяйстве есть 14 коров, 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). Все полученные средства она старается вкладывать в воспитание детей, так как они - главная ценность в жизни Кенжегул. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение ассортимента товара в магазине. Доходы от кредита она будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса, увеличение поголовья овец и постройку сарая.
texts.en:
Kenzhegul is 36 and married with three children. She has a specialist high school education and has been selling groceries for seven years, with a working capital of 150,000 KGS. She also works in animal husbandry and has 14 cows and 20 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 20,000 KGS.

Kenzhegul puts as much of her money as possible into raising her children, since they are the most valuable thing in her life. She has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 60,000 KGS to increase the assortment of goods in her shop. She will put profits from the loan into further developing her business, increasing her number of sheep and building a barn.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of food products in her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for milk production to enable him to purchase metal bars for making metal doors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable her to increase the number of litres of milk she can supply to her customers and satisfy their demand for milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy retail stock for trade

loans.name: Famille Dodos Group

texts.fr: Dodos a reçu en héritage une concession familiale dans laquelle il cultive le café il y a de cela 18 ans. Il projette ajouter dans son champ 1500 autres plantules mais pour l'instant ce crédit lui servira à la prise en charge de frais d'entretien et de récolte qui pointe à l'horizon; l'insuffisance de moyens financiers étant le premier obstacle qui freine son activité. Il est le chef de ménage et pose sur la photo avec son épouse.
texts.en: Dodos received a family plot of land as an inheritance 18 years ago and he grows coffee on it. He is planning to add 1500 more plantlets to his field, but for the moment this loan will be used to cover maintenance costs and expenses relating to the harvest which is on the horizon. His lack of financial resources is the main hurdle which is restricting his activity. He is the head of the household and is posing in the photo with his wife.

loans.use: to maintain his field and harvest it.

loans.name: Carlos Oswaldo

texts.es: Carlos es un seños de 52 años de edad, tiene 3 hijas de las edades de  16, 18 y 20 años de edad  misma que están estudiando, Carlos se dedica a trabajar en una  mecánica y también se  dedica a la crianza de pollos, Carlos comenta que es su madre es quien le ayuda al cuidado sus animales y asi este negocio lo hacen familiar,  Carlos comenta que con el dinero del crédito va  a comprar pollos para lograr mejorar su negocio y su mayor aspiración es de aumentar sus ingresos para terminar  de dar los estudios a sus hijas y asi tengan un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Carlos is 52, and has three daughters aged 16, 18 and 20, who are all in education. 

He earns his living working in a mechanic's shop, but also rears chickens. 

Carlos says that his mother helps out with the animals, so it is a family business. 

He also says that he will use the money from this loan to buy chickens in order to improve his business, and that his greatest wish is to increase his income so that his daughters can complete their education, and have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмира погасила свой кредит, она благодарна фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве на сегодня есть корова, бычок, лошадь и 12 овец. На арендованном участке мерою 1,0 Га, где она выращивает люцерну.  Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). Гульмира вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, часть средств направит на ремонт дома. За счет прибыли от проекта Гульмира собирается и дальше развивать свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Gulmira paid off her previous loan. She is thankful to Kiva and to everyone who supported her financially. She currently has a cow, a steer, a horse and 12 sheep on her farm, as well as 1 hectare of rented land where she grows lucerne (alfalfa). Her monthly income is 12,000 KGS.

Gulmira has approached Bai Tushum Bank once more for a loan of 80,000 KGS to purchase livestock and to renovate her house. She intends to use the profits to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her herd and to make some improvements to her house

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнура, 27 лет, замужем. У нее среднее образование, сельским хозяйством занимается около 9 лет, начав с 8,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день имеет 7 коров, 8 овец, 5 лошадей. На арендованном участке мерою 2,90 Га и собственном в 15,60 Га она выращивает картофель, люцерну, пшеницу и ячмень для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход Айнуры составляет от 7,000 сом (KDS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 дойных коров, для увеличения объемов реализации экологически-чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Айнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, что позволит ей накопить на покупку автомобиля для семьи.
texts.en:
Ainura is 27, married, and has a secondary school education.  She's been a farmer for roughly 9 years, first starting with 8,000 som.  She currently has 7 cows, 8 sheep, and 5 horses.  She rents 2.90 hectares of land and has 15.60 hectares of her own land for growing potatoes, alfalfa, wheat and barley for use on her farm and as a cash crop.  Her monthly income is upwards of 7,000 som.  

For the future development of her farm, she's requested a loan of 150,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy 3 dairy cows in order to increase her volume of organic milk sales.  She plans on putting her extra income due to the loan towards the future development of her business, which will allow her to buy a family car.

loans.use: buy three dairy cows to increase organic milk sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to set up a small shop in her home.

loans.name: Jhony Esteban

texts.es: A su corta edad que son 20 años Esteban se dedica a la crianza de pollos y a trabajar en una  mecánica, Esteban  vive con sus padres que se dedican a la agricultura y es de ahí de donde aprendió a la crianza de animales menores, Esteban necesita el crédito para comprar pollos y asi incrementar su negocio, la aspiración de Esteban es de mejorar su negocio y de las ganancias formarse algún capital para continuar sus estudios que los dejo por falta de recursos económicos.
texts.en: At his young age of 20, Esteban earns a living breeding chickens and works as a mechanic. He lives with his parents who work as farmers and this is how he learned to breed small animals. Esteban needs this loan to buy chickens and therefore expand his business, he aspires to improve his business and with the earnings get some capital to be able to continue with his studies that he had to leave due to a lack of economic resources.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Mauro Octaviano

texts.es: A sus 30 años de edad Mauro es un joven muy activo, que se esfuerza  para salir adelante, son 6 años que se dedica a la venta de lubricantes y repuestos de autos, Mauro tiene una hija de 7 meses de edad, Mauro necesita el dinero del crédito para invertir en lubricantes y repuestos para autos, Mauro tiene la aspiración de mejorar su negocio, ofrecer, mas mercadería y de este modo aumentar sus venta y contratar a otra persona que le ayude en su negocio y brindar servicio de mecánica,  Mauro comenta que en la actualidad tiene un joven trabajando en su negocio. Mauro se esfuerza día a día y esto lo hace por el bienestar de su hija.
texts.en:
At thirty years of age, Mauro is a very active man, who works hard to get ahead in life. He has a seven month old daughter. 

For six years he has been selling lubricants and spare parts for cars. 

Mauro needs the money from this loan to buy these lubricants and spare parts. He wishes to improve his business, by offering more goods to increase his sales, hiring someone to help with the business, and offering mechanic services. Mauro says that he currently has one young person working for him.

Mauro works hard every single day, which he does for the well being of his daughter.

loans.use: to buy lubricants

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María, de 48 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está viuda y sus hijos tienen su hogar aparte y ella solo vive con una sobrina.   

María, es comerciante de ropa, se dedicó a este trabajo desde hace 4 años y lo aprendió de una amiga,  decidió ponerlo en práctica desde que su esposo falleció; ella sale a ofrecer la ropa a su comunidad y su horario es de 9 horas.

María, necesita el crédito para comprar más ropa y ampliar más su negocio y ofrecerle nuevos productos a sus clientes.
 
Los sueños de María es, poder invertir y que su negocio sea estable y sostenible para salir adelante.
texts.en:
María is 48 years old. She studied up until 6th grade. She is a widow and her children have their own homes and so she lives only with a nephew.

María sells clothes. She has been doing it was 4 years and learned it from a friend. She decided to start this after her husband died. She goes out selling clothes in her community for 9 hours a day.

María needs this loan to buy more clothes and expand her business and offer new products to her customers.

Her dreams are to be able to invest and also that her business be stable and sustainable in order to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and expand her business.

loans.name: Terry

texts.en:
Terry is 39 years old. He is married and has two children, one in grade 10 and the other in Grade 1. He has completed secondary school and worked in trading since then. 

Terry started his own Zoona business in order to provide financial services to his community. This has allowed people in his community to send and receive money without having to travel long distances to the nearest bank. 

Terry is requesting a loan in order to grow his business by increasing the money he uses to serve customers in his business. This would allow Terry to bring his Zoona services to other communities that would benefit from access to financial services and would also allow him to further support his family financially. 

Terry thanks the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to grow his business by increasing the money he uses so that he can serve more people who need to access financial services

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 34 years old, married to Bernard and blessed with four children aged 14, 12, 8 and 6 years old. She has been selling plastic items for the last eight years and earns a monthly income of 10,000 Kenya Shillings (KES). 

She has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production to enable her educate her children and purchase more stock for her business. 

Her plans are to use gained profits to repay the loan and the remaining cash to pay school fees for her children and increase her stock. 

Her hope is to grow in business.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for milk production to enable her to educate her children

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 42-year-old cereals dealer in Changamwe, Kenya. She is a married mother of five whose husband provides additional income and has been in this business for the last two years and has done well.

This marks her first borrowing from Visionfund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the requested loan to purchase dry cereals, maize, beans, green grams and cleaning detergents. She hopes to own a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase dry cereals, maize, beans, green grams and cleaning detergents

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to earn more from the supply of milk to customers

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
Flor, de 33 años de edad, está casada, estudio hasta noveno grado, se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. junto a su esposo e hijos, a quienes enviá a la escuela, mientras ella se dedica a actividades comerciales y su esposo se dedica a la albañilería para llevarle el sustento al hogar.

Flor, se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras de temporada como mango, jocotes, aguacate y banano; este oficio lo aprendió de su madre, todas las frutas las compra en los alrededores de su residencia y luego va a vender al mercado.- Además, se dedica a vender leche, ya que tiene 3 vacas que ordeña.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar una vaca más, porque se la venden para producir más leche y elaborar queso. 

Flor, sueña en el futuro poder comprar un terreno para tener sus animales, ya que actualmente alquila terrenos para poder tener el ganado, ya que viven en una parte muy estrecha donde no se pueden tener más de 5 vacas.
texts.en:
Flor is 33 years old, she is married and studied until 9th grade. She gets up at 5am along with her husband and children. She sends her children to school while she works in commercial activities and her husband works in construction in order to earn a living for the household.

Flor sells seasonal fruit and vegetables such as mangos, green peppers, avocados and bananas. She learned this from her mother. She buys all of the fruits from near her home and then goes to sell them at the market. She also earns a living selling milk as she has 3 milk cows.

The loan that she is asking for is to buy another cow, as they are sold in order to produce more milk and make cheese.

Flor dreams in he future of being able to buy land for her animals as currently she rents land for the livestock as they live in a very small area where they cannot keep more than 5 cows.

loans.use: to buy another cow.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Edina is 39 years old. She is married and is the mother of seven children whose ages range from 12 years old to one year old. Edina provides for her family financially and has previously worked full time.

Edina started her own Zoona business in order to earn more income to support her children as well as to benefit her community. Edina’s Zoona business provides financial services that would otherwise not be available to her community. Before Edina started her business, people would travel long distances in order to access banks or other financial institutions.

Edina is requesting a loan in order to expand her business to other rural communities that lack access to these financial services. This loan will allow her to grow her business, provide further financial support for her family, and serve other communities that are in need of these services.

loans.use: to expand her business to other rural communities that lack access to these financial services

loans.name: Mbaya

texts.en:
Mbaya is 32 years old. She has two brothers and a sister. Mbaya provides for her late brother’s children and is responsible for their education. She has completed secondary school and college and has a certificate in printing technology.

Mbaya started her own Zoona business in order to provide people in her community with access to financial services. She very much enjoys meeting the variety of different people who use her service and strives to provide them with a quality service. Mbaya describes her Zoona business as one that enables people in the community to send money to their loved ones.

This is Mbaya’s second loan from Kiva. She received her first loan in December 2014 to purchase two trading booths. She has opened her two new locations and is happy with the new customers. Mbaya is requesting a loan in order to expand her business by increasing the float that she uses to serve her customers.

She is hoping to grow her business in order to serve more people, as well as to increase her income so that she can one day achieve her academic dreams and continue to financially support her family.

loans.use: to grow her business by increasing her float levels so that she can serve more people who need to access financial services

loans.name: Trace

texts.en:
Trace is 31 years old. He is married and has two children, who are in grades 5 and 3, respectively. 

Trace completed his secondary school and subsequently worked in sales at one of the Coca-Cola micro distributors in Lusaka. Trace has started his own micro distribution center to provide his community with Coca-Cola products such as Fanta, Sprite and Coca-Cola. 

Trace states that it is his dream to be his own boss and that his Coca-Cola business is allowing him to achieve it. He is requesting a loan in order to help him with his stock levels. He is taking out a Kiva loan so that he can purchase crates of soft drinks to increase his stock levels. 

Trace is hopeful that the loan will help him grow his business. He explains that accessing capital is very hard in Zambia, and it has been tough to inject money into the business. He is grateful for the opportunity to be on Kiva. This will allow Trace to grow his business and further support his family financially.

loans.use: to grow his business by purchasing crates of soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to have money in his business so that he can serve customers who need to access financial services

loans.name: Kingsley

texts.en:
Kingsley is 24 years old. He is the first of five children in his family. He is currently studying part time to obtain a diploma in financial accounting. Kingsley is excited to work with Zoona because it will give him the opportunity to learn more about being an entrepreneur and will bolster his business skills. He dreams of becoming a successful entrepreneur and of eventually opening many Zoona outlets so that he can create employment.

Kingsley is requesting a loan to access working capital to get his Zoona business off the ground and have the means of achieving his dreams. He will purchase a Zoona branded kiosk, some branded fee posters, a web-enabled mobile phone, a chair and a cash box. With this loan, Kingsley will be able to serve customers who need to access financial services in Blantyre. Blantyre is the second largest city in Malawi. Kingsley will be one of the main operators of Zoona mobile money transfers in the city, and a number of unbanked people in the community will be using his service.

loans.use: to purchase a Zoona branded kiosk, some branded fee posters, a web-enabled mobile phone, a chair and a cash box.

loans.name: Víctor Alexander

texts.es:
Víctor es un joven estudiante de SENATI, que vive junto a su madre; quien se gana la vida trabajando de manera independiente, ella vende chicha morada (bebida tradicional peruana). Su padre los abandonó cuando Víctor era muy pequeño. Motivo por el cual Víctor tuvo que ayudar a su madre con la venta de la chicha morada y también mazamorra morada (postre tradicional peruano).
Víctor actualmente estudia el IV Ciclo de la carrera de Mantenimiento de Maquinaria Pesada, la cual le parece muy interesante ya que es analítica y requiere de ciertas habilidades que considera que considera tener. Desde muy pequeño le llamó la atención las maquinarias pesadas, siente que es su vocación y lo beneficiará mejorando su calidad de vida. Su sueño en un futuro no muy lejano es fundar una ONG.
Debido a sus horarios de clases, a Víctor le es muy difícil continuar apoyando a su madre, quien trata de muchas maneras de que su hijo no deje de estudiar, porque la carrera que eligió es muy costosa y ni él ni su madre cuentan con los medios necesarios. Por ello, están recurriendo al apoyo de KIVA para que pueda continuar con sus estudios y culminarlos exitosamente.
Víctor quiere agradecerles por la gran ayuda que le brindarán para poder culminar sus estudios, ya que es su vocación, tiene muchos proyectos y planes a futuro; también ayudará mucho a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia; así como también brindará ayuda a las personas que viven en muy escasos recursos. Les agradece muchísimo su apoyo y valorará el apoyo que le brindan.
texts.en:
Victor is a young SENATI student who lives with his mother.  She earns her living working for herself; she sells chicha morada [a traditional Peruvian drink].  Victor's father abandoned them when he was very young, which was the reason Victor had to help his mother sell chica morada and mazamorra morada [a traditional Peruvian dish].  

Victor is currently studying in his fourth semester for a degree in heavy machinery maintenance, which seems rather interesting to him as it's analytical and requires certain skills which he is thinking of acquiring.  Since he was very little, heavy machinery attracted his attention, and he feels that it's his calling and that it will benefit him by improving his quality of life.  His dream in the near future is to start an NGO.

Due to his class schedule, it's very difficult for Victor to continue supporting his mother who tries her best in various ways to ensure that her son continues his studies.  The degree program he chose is very costly and neither him nor his mother have the necessary money to pay for it; for that reason, they're turning to Kiva for support so that he can continue studying and graduate successfully.  

Victor wants to thank you for the big help you'll give him to help him finish his studies as it's his calling, and he has a lot of projects and plans for the future; it will also help him improve his quality of life a lot more, and that of his family as well.  It will also help people who live in scarcity.  He thanks you a lot for your help and will value the support you give him.

loans.use: pay his tuition as a SENATI student in a degree program for heavy machinery maintenance and help him successfully finish his studies.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos, es un joven estudiante de SENATI, natural de Lima, vive junto a su madre y sus 4 hermanas. Su padre falleció. Su madre realiza la labor de cocinera en un restaurante, para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos. Él apoya a su madre trabajando como mozo en el mismo restaurante, pero el ingreso que percibe es mínimo.
Juan Carlos actualmente se encuentra estudiando el II Ciclo de Administración Industrial en SENATI, la cual le interesó mucho desde muy niño y siente que le permitirá sacar adelante a su familia, apoyando a su madre con la educación de sus hermanas.
De no contar con el apoyo de KIVA, Juan Carlos tendría que dejar de estudiar este semestre y trabajar para reunir el dinero necesario que le permita poder retomar sus estudios, para culminar sus estudios.
Juan Carlos se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo que pueda brindarle KIVA para poder culminar su carrera de manera exitosa, le augura muchos éxitos en la labor que realizan al apoyar a jóvenes con deseos de superación.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a young student at SENATI, a trade institute in Peru.  He is from Lima and lives with his mother and his four sisters.  His father died.  His mother is a cook in a restaurant in order to carry her children forward in life.  He supports his mother by working as a waiter in the same restaurant, but the income that he receives is minimal.  Currently, Juan Carlos is studying Stage II of the Industrial Management degree, which he has been interested in since he was a child.  He feels that it will enable him to carry his family forward by helping his mother with his sisters’ education.

Without the support of Kiva, Juan Carlos would have to stop studying this semester and work to gather the money necessary for him to resume and complete his studies.  Juan Carlos is very grateful for the support that Kiva can give him in order to successfully finish his degree.  He has a bright future, thanks to the work that Kiva does to support young people with the desire to succeed.

loans.use: To be able to continue his studies in Industrial Management at SENATI, a trade institute

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Bertha is 26 years old. She is married and has two young children, a boy aged 6 and a 1-year-old girl. She lives in the Mchinji border town in Malawi. She has just completed training with Zoona to finally make her dream of running her own business come true. 

Bertha needs a loan to make her dream a reality. When Bertha finished secondary school, she took a short course in banking. She then worked for two companies as a cashier. She describes herself as hardworking and friendly. 

Bertha will use this loan to start up a business of mobile money transfers in her hometown of Mchinji. She will be able to purchase a trading kiosk, which she can use to serve her customers. She will also use the money to buy a mobile phone, which she will use to facilitate transactions. The other half of the funds will be used to serve her customers by providing the necessary funds needed for her to pay out for customers who need to receive money. 

Bertha explains how running her own business will change her life. She says she will be able to take her children to better schools and support her relatives. She has six siblings and would like to be financially independent so that she can send money back home. This prospect excites her, and she cannot wait to begin operating her very own Zoona mobile money outlet. She thanks the Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase a trading kiosk and a mobile phone and access the capital float needed for her to serve people who need financial services

loans.name: Kabila

texts.en:
Kabila is 39 years old. She is married and has three children who are 16, 13, and 11 years old, and are all in school. 

Kabila completed college and has worked as a teacher in entrepreneurship before starting her own Zoona business. Kabila’s Zoona business provides her community with basic financial services that they are in need of. 

Kabila is requesting a loan in order to increase the money she has available in her business to serve customers. This would allow her to better serve her customers and not turn anyone away, as well as to grow her business. She dreams of growing her business and supporting her children through their education, and this loan would help her achieve those goals.

loans.use: to increase the money she has available in her business to serve customers who need to access financial services

loans.name: Yollanda

texts.en:
Yollanda is 23 years old. She is the first born in a family of five children and lives in Ntchisi, Malawi, with her family. 

Yollanda would like to start running her own business. She requires a loan from Kiva to make this happen. This loan will help Yollanda pay for her setup costs. She will be able to purchase a trading kiosk, a mobile phone to be used to serve her customers, a chair where she can sit as she serves her customers, and a cash box where she can keep her cash for safety. This loan will also provide Yollanda with the float needed for her to serve her customers. 

Zoona has done market research in the area where Yollanda is going to set up, and has determined that the location for this kiosk is ideal. Yollanda will be one of the main operators of Zoona mobile money transfers in Ntchisi, and a number of families will be using her service to send and receive their monies. 

This opportunity to run her own business means a lot to Yollanda. She will have some income to cater for her basic needs. She is hopeful that she will become financially stable through this business, and hopes to be able to start helping out financially at home.

loans.use: to start running her own business of mobile money transfers in Ntchisi, Malawi

loans.name: Memory

texts.en:
This is 20-year-old Memory. She is the first born in a family of seven. She runs her own Zoona mobile money transfer business. She provides financial services in Karonga district, Malawi, to people in her community who need to access financial services. 

Before Memory started running her own business, she was staying at home as she faced challenges in finding employment. She decided to start running her own business so that she could provide for her basic needs and help create employment for her fellow youths. 

Memory has requested a Kiva loan so that she can start running her own Zoona mobile money transfer business. Her business allows people in her community to send and receive money. With this loan, she will be able to purchase and own the operating equipment she currently uses, these being a trading kiosk, a mobile phone, a chair and a cashbox. The loan will also ensure that Memory has money to serve her customers. 

Memory would like to take this opportunity to thank Kiva for helping her realize her dream of being financially independent.

loans.use: to pay for the mobile phone, chair, cashbox, branding materials and money that she uses to serve her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and sales to enable him to pay school fees for his children who are in various high schools.

loans.name: Lusina

texts.en:
Lusina is a 38-year-old lady. She is married to Richard and together they have been blessed with five children. Lusina is a farmer, a business she has done for the last 14 years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to buy a dairy cow for milk production and to finance her agricultural business.
 
With the generated profits, Lusina will be able to educate her children as well as repay the loan. Her hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and to finance the growth of her agricultural business.

loans.name: Bombole

texts.en:
Bombole is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over seven years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in more products for the store and to make some repairs on his vehicle

loans.name: Seda

texts.en:
Seda, 33 years old, runs a small farm. She enjoys her farming business a lot. On her farm, Seda cultivates tomato, onion, pepper and watermelon and earns a profit from selling the harvest. Seda's husband also is actively involved in the farming business by selling the harvest in local markets.

To be able to enlarge her farming activities, Seda has now applied for this loan. She needs to purchase fertilizer, fuel and seeds for the farm.

As this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, fuel and seeds for her farm

loans.name: Chifundo

texts.en:
Chifundo is an emerging entrepreneur. He is 30 years old and comes from a family of four. He comes from Mchinji and lives with his parents in Lilongwe.

Chifundo has just completed training with Zoona to start running his own Zoona mobile money transfer business. He will be based in Kasungu district. He is very happy with this life-changing opportunity and promises to work hard to service the community of Kasungu. 

Chifundo has always wanted to run his own business and feels this is a wonderful opportunity to live his dream. His business will provide financial services to people in the community. They will be able to send and receive money from his Zoona kiosk. He plans to open his kiosk seven days a week so that customers can have access to mobile money everyday. 

Chifundo has requested a Kiva loan so that he can pay for his setup costs. This loan will be used to buy a branded trading kiosk, framed fee posters and some uniforms. He will also buy an Internet-enabled mobile phone, a cashbox and a chair. The funds will also be used as float for him to serve his customers. 

Chifundo is hopeful that the profits he will get from his business will help him to provide for his basic needs. He explains that one of the challenges he faces is that he does not have any source of income and has to constantly ask his parents for help. He thanks Zoona and Kiva for helping him make his dream come true.

loans.use: to pay for his trading kiosk, a web-enabled phone, a cashbox and a chair, and access the money needed for him to make transactions

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman aged 49 years and has eight children who are all grown-ups. She lives in a semi-urban setting and her family lives far away from where she operates her store. She runs a grocery shop which sells all types of food items and beverages. She has been operating since 1994 and supplements her family income with agriculture and bakery services. 

Mary works seven days a week and each day she works for 14 hours. She started this business so that she could earn a living for her children since she and her husband are retired from employment.

She has acquired this loan facility in order to re-stock her business since she is expecting high sales in this Easter season. Her customers are fellow residents around and her dream is to expand the business to the level of wholesale. Her biggest challenge is limited capital. 

Mary describes herself as an honest woman and urges all women to be innovative and enterprising.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Rodrick

texts.en:
Rodrick is 26 years old. He is married and has a four-month-old son. He comes from a family of eight. Rodrick works hard to support his family, most notably, his wife and son. Rodrick has worked contract jobs in computing on and off since finishing his Information Technology course. He has just completed training with Zoona to start running his own Zoona mobile money transfer business. 

Rodrick’s business will allow families in Mwanza to send and receive money. Rodrick is happy to work with Zoona because it will give him the opportunity to run his own business and earn some profits. He dreams of becoming a successful entrepreneur and opening more Zoona mobile money transfer outlets.    

Rodrick is requesting a loan in order to get working capital to get his Zoona business off the ground and have the means to achieve his dreams. He will purchase a Zoona-branded kiosk, some branded fee posters, and a web-enabled mobile phone, a chair and a cash box. With this loan, Rodrick will be able to serve customers who need to access financial services in Mwanza. 

Zoona has done market research in Mwanza and has determined that the location for this kiosk is ideal. Rodrick will be the main operator of Zoona mobile money transfers in the district and a number of unbanked people in the community will have access to his service. He thanks Kiva lenders and urges them to continue with their kindness of lending and believing in people like him.

loans.use: To purchase a kiosk, fee posters, and a web-enabled phone, a chair and a cash box to enable him to serve customers who need to access financial services in Mwanza

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is a 25-year-old micro-entrepreneur. She is the last born in a family of six. She lives with her parents, who are both unemployed. Jacqueline needs a loan in order to start running her own Zoona mobile money transfer business. This is a franchise business that deals in the sending and receiving of money. Jacqueline would like to set up her business in Blantyre, Malawi.

Jacqueline is very hardworking. To provide for her family, she currently sells Chitenge fabrics (fabric worn by women wrapped around the chest, waist and commonly used as a baby sling). She does not have a shop and so she carries the fabrics with her and goes around town looking for customers. This can get frustrating and the profit margins are very low.
