Doña Luisa is asking for a loan because she wishes to invest more in her business and to buy the fruit and utensils that she uses to make her drinks.  Her goals and plans are to improve her site of business, to prepare her granddaughter to be a professional, and to see her daughters as good people.

loans.use: to buy the fruit and utensils that she uses to make drinks.

loans.name: Merita

texts.en:
Merita wants to buy potato seeds for planting; her family owns only two dynym (about two hectares) of agricultural land which is almost next to nothing for someone whose agriculture is the only source of income for the entire family, as in her case. 

So she has rented from others as well about seven dynym where she can plant potatoes. From the cows she has, she sells the raw milk to a nearby dairy farm at a price of $.4/liter compare to $.8/liter, should she sell it directly to users. Yet, living in the village makes it difficult for her to travel everyday to the city's market to sell the milk.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds to plant.

loans.name: María Celsa

texts.es:
María, de 36 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora, está acompañada y su pareja ha emigrado al extranjero y ella se encarga de cuidar a sus dos hijos, ellos estudian y ella trabaja para ayudarles a su formación.

María, tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa de habitación, en la cual vende azúcar, golosinas y cereales, hace un par de años decidió colocarla y hasta hoy todo le ha salido bien, ya que sus hijos le ayudan.

María, solicita el préstamo para invertir nuevamente en su tienda, ya que la ultima inversión considerable que hizo fue antes de las fiestas navideñas y se a quedado con pocos productos para vender.

Ella siempre sueña con ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales de éxito.
texts.en:
María, who is 36 years old, is a very hardworking woman. She is in a common law partnership and her partner has emigrated abroad. She has responsibility for looking after their two children, they are studying and she works to help them with their education.

María has a small shop in the house where she lives, where she sells sugar, sweets and cereals. She decided to set it up a couple of years ago and up until now everything has gone well, as her children help her. 

She is asking for the loan to invest again in her shop, since her last considerable investment was before the Christmas holidays and she is left with few products to sell.

She always dreams of seeing her children become successful professionals.

loans.use: to invest once again in her shop.

loans.name: Danitza

texts.en: Danitza describes herself as a responsible person who always pays her debts on time, regularly putting aside part of her salary for that purpose. Danitza just completed her university studies to become a public accountant and now works at the university in the information department. She is requesting a loan to pay for expenses related to her graduation paperwork.

loans.use: To pay for her college graduation expenses.

loans.name: Isaura

texts.en: Isaura is 43 years old, married and has three grownup and independent sons. She has been working as a street vendor for the last seven years selling newspapers and magazines. She is asking for a loan to buy more magazines in order to offer more variety to her clients and increase her sales. She says that with her work she has been able to support her husband, send her kids to school and make some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy newspapers and magazines to sell in the street.

loans.name: Josue Isai

texts.en:
Josue Isai, 29 years old, has been married to Natalia for seven years. They have three children: Ana, seven, Ivan, four  and Matias one. Josue, who is in charge of a warehouse's inventory, says that he and his wife work very hard every single day to support them. 

Josue is requesting a loan to begin construction of a house on a piece of land that they own. His goals are to support his family and continue to improve in his work.

loans.use: to build a house for his family.

loans.name: Joaquim

texts.pt:
O Sr. Joaquim  de 50 anos de idade, viuvo pai de 3  filhos dos quais 2 sao independente 1 esta a frequentar a escola na Academia Militar. Ele è militar a mais de 30 anos.
Os 2 emprestimos anteriores foram aplicado para  compra de material de contrucao e o presente emprestimo sera aplicado na comprar material de construcao (blocos, cimento, varoes, pedra e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para a construcao de muro da sua casa.
Tem como grande desafio melhorar as condicoes de habitacao e a  dieta almentar da sua familia.
texts.en:
Joaquim is 50 years old and a widower. He has three children, two of whom are independent and one attends school at the Military Academy. He has been a serviceman for over 30 years.
The previous two loans were used to purchase construction supplies. The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (bricks, cement, rods, rocks) and to pay for labor so he can build a wall around his house.
His great challenge is improving his family's diet and living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (bricks, cement, rods, rocks) and to pay for labor so he can build a wall.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is 60 years old and she lives in El Alto. She is a seamstress and she makes sports clothing for adults and children. Rita is very hardworking and she also works as a cook at night, and cooks and sells hot dogs and hamburgers.  Rita needs a loan to buy wool. Rita would like to have a bigger workshop and hire some helpers in the future. Rita is the mother of two but they are adults already so they can't help her.

loans.use: to buy wool for her business

loans.name: Hugo

texts.en: Hugo is married and he is still living with his parents-in-law. Hugo is making money as an employee for a dining company. Hugo has two children and he is asking for a loan to repair a couple of rooms which he and his family use constantly. Hugo would like his own house in the future and he hopes you can help him. The house is property of Hugo's parents-in-law.

loans.use: to repair a couple of rooms.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is married and has two children. She has her own business. 

Marina sells electrical goods such as light bulbs, batteries, sockets, switches, and flashlights. She also sells products for shoe care. Marina is an active and ambitious person. She wants to have a good business, to build a house and to raise her  children. 

Marina is asking for a loan of 20,000 UAH to buy electric products for sale. The loan will help her to increase the assortment of goods and increase her income.

loans.use: to  increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en: Teopista is a 45-year-old hardworking lady with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells waragi, a local brew, and at the same time grows bananas. She is faced with the challenge of limited capital that hinder the progress of her business. She has asked for a loan to rent a Kisubi (banana plantation) to make waragi, a local brew, to sell.

loans.use: to rent a Kisubi (banana plantation) to make waragi, a local brew, to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria is 39 years old she is single and she doesn t have children Maria lives at her parents house and she helps a lot there because she loves her mother and father. Maria is one of the few  carpenter bolivian women and she needs a loan to buy wood especially pine wood to make more furniture Maria learned carpentry when she was a child she was trained by her father and mother so she has experience and she hopes you can help her
texts.en: Maria is 39 years old and single with no children. Maria lives at her parents' house and she helps a lot there because she loves her mother and father. Maria is one of the few Bolivian female carpenters. She needs a loan to buy wood, especially pine wood, to make more furniture. Maria learned carpentry when she was a child. Se was trained by her father and mother so she has experience and she hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy wood especially pine wood

loans.name: Lidia Esperanza

texts.es:
Lidia, de 53 años de edad, estudio solamente primer grado, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 8 años, tiene 9 hijos, 5 de ellos viven aún con ella, pero solo cuatro van a la escuela. 

Lidia, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, pero también ayuda a su esposo en la siembra de maíz, mucho tiempo antes de comenzar el invierno, ella tiene que tener el dinero para comprar los fertilizantes, la semilla y otros insumos agrícolas necesarios para la siembra.- Tiene ocho años de ayudarle a su esposo, el lugar donde tiene ese terreno, está a 10 minutos de su casa.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar una yunta de bueyes, ya que por problemas de salud y de mal tiempo en el invierno, tuvo que vender los bueyes que tenia, es por eso que necesita urgentemente el crédito, esperan que este invierno sea mejor que el anterior, para poder obtener mejores ganancias de sus cosechas.

Lidia, desea es que los hijos que están estudiando, sean unas profesionales y que los bueyes que compren les sirva para sacar todo los cultivos.
texts.en:
Lidia is 53 years old. She completed first grade at school. She is married and has nine children, five of whom still live with her and four of them go to school. Her husband has worked in agriculture for eight years.

Lidia works as a housekeeper, but she also helps her husband to sow the cornfield. Long before the winter arrives, she must have the money to buy fertilizers, seeds, and other inputs needed for the planting. She's been helping her husband for eight years. The farming plot is located 10 minutes from her house.  

She needs the loan to buy a team of oxen. She had to sell her oxen due to health problems and bad weather last winter, and this is why she now urgently needs the loan. They're hoping this  will be a better winter so they can get better income from their harvests.

Lidia's dream is for her children who are studying to become professionals, and for the oxen she's buying to prove serviceable in the field.

loans.use: to buy a team of oxen.

loans.name: Claudio Alejandro

texts.en: Claudio works at a trading company in the systems department. He has been working for more than 20 years and says that he enjoys his work. He lives with his wife and two children. He describes his family as happy and normal. He is asking for a loan to fix his car because the expenses were unexpected and he needs the car for work and his family. He has been a Kubo Financiero client and repaid his first loan on time.

loans.use: To fix his car.

loans.name: Itzel Paola

texts.en: Itzel Paola is 22 years old, single and lives with her parents. She works with her parents in a business where they produce dairy products such as yogurt, cream, cheese and some desserts. She is asking for a loan to buy some inputs for her business. She sells the products door to door. She says that her parents have raised cattle for many years. She decided to use the milk that they produce to expand the business by producing some value-added products.

loans.use: To buy inputs to make marmalade and dairy products.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.en:
Miguel is 26 years old, married and has a two-year-old daughter (pictured with him). He describes himself as an entrepreneur who works everyday to be a better person. Miguel is currently in his sixth semester studying systems engineering, hoping to someday get a good job. 

Miguel lives with his family in his parents' house, and he and his wife sell gifts and ceramic products. He also works providing electric maintenance to banking branches. Miguel is requesting a loan to buy more products, convinced that he can increase sales and earn additional income.

loans.use: To buy products for his gift shop.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.en: MIguel Angel works driving a taxi and also receives small monthly pension. His credit worthiness is demonstrated by the fact that he repaid his first loan on time, and he is now requesting a second loan to continue making improvements to his home.

loans.use: to make improvements (such as painting, waterproofing and fixing cracks) to his home

loans.name: Claudia Ivonne

texts.en: Claudia Ivonne is 24 years old and describes herself as an entrepreneur, efficient and hard working. She has had her own grocery store for the last five years and now is opening a paper supply store.  In her grocery store, she also provides access to the internet to customers. She is asking for a loan to restock her store and acquire some fixed assets.  Her goal is to continue to invest in her business and grow as a person.

loans.use: To restock and refurbish her grocery store

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.en: Maria Del Socorro is 54 years old, single and has four grown and independent sons. She has worked in sales for the last four years. Before that, she used to work as a cashier and then decided to become independent. She describes herself as entrepreneurial, reliable and constant. She is asking for a loan to buy cosmetics and beauty products that she and her sister will sell in a small place that they adapted. She says that her biggest achievement has been being able to start her own business and support herself. Her goal is to continue to make it grow.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and beauty products to sell

loans.name: Israel Ascensión

texts.en: Israel is 62 years old, married and has five independent sons. He works in furniture upholstery and is asking for a loan to buy some fabric for his business. He has been doing this work for more than 34 years. He says that his biggest achievement is supporting his family and sending his sons to school.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for furniture upholstery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron, etc. to build a kitchen in her home.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda always has enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated their rice land in Mahayag and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase fertilizer, a knapsack sprayer and pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Erlinda knows that she has to get things right to yield more income from this cropping season. In the future, Erlinda hopes to buy a hauling truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, a knapsack sprayer and pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: Edlyn

texts.en:
Edlyn is 29 years old and single with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Edlyn has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling frozen foods.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Albertina

texts.pt:
A Sra. Albertina de 51 anos de idade solteira e mae de 6 filhos dos quais 4 sao independentes 2 estao afrequentar a escola no ensino secundario e primario. Ela è funcionaria do Ministerio de Educacao e Cultura exercendo actividades de  servente a mais de 15 anos è tambem agricultora pratica agricultura de sequeiro culturas de Milho e Mandioca actividade que esta a ser acompanhada junto com seus filhos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (cimento, areia e pagamento de mao-de-obra)para reabilitar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Albertina is 51 years old and single. She has six children, four of whom are independent and two attend secondary and primary school. She has worked as a cleaner for the Ministry of Education and Culture for over 15 years. She's also a farmer who engages in dryland farming. She grows corn and manioc, a business she runs alongside her children.
The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (cement, sand) and to pay for labor so that she can repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, sand) and to pay for labor so that she can repair her house.

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Vuthy, 31, lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He has two children who are currently in school. To make a living and support his family, he works very hard on his own farmland. He primarily grows and sells rice to the local dealers and customers in the market. On average, he is able to make an income of 3 USD a day. So far, he has been in this career for ten years. 

To accelerate his farming process, he wants to buy cows to help in plowing the land and carry many heavy farming materials. Because there is insufficient money, he would like to apply for a Kiva loan via HKL to buy the cows. With the support from this loan, he hopes that his farming can be more efficient. He is thankful to all the lenders for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge tiene 59 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y su nieto de 15 años de edad. Jorge se dedica a la elaboración de estructuras metálicas desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la ampliación y cambio de techo del corredor de la vivienda. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera, hierro, etc. Espera poder contar con dicho financiamiento y de esta forma dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Jorge is 59 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and their 15 year old grandson. Jorge has made metallic structures for a long time and that is how he earns a living and supports his home. Wanting to improve his living conditions, he is asking for this loan from FUSAI to invest in expanding and changing the roof of the corridor of his house. With the amount he has asked for, he will buy galvanized sheeting, wood, iron, etc. He hopes to be able to have the loan and in this way give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting, wood, iron, etc., to expand and change the roof over the corridor of his house.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Leng, 55, is residing in the Kampong Speu Province of Cambodia. She has five children in total; one is married while the other four are single. She is a Khmer food seller and earns, on average, an income of USD 3.00 a day. So far, she has been in this type of business for 15 years. Currently, she would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of traveling. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Judith works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from pig fattening. Judith is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net, gasoline and materials for her fishing business.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fising net, gasoline and materials

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 61 years old and widowed with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell.

Anita has been in this business for 20 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Mary Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling vegetables. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional wood, paints, bamboo and fishing net for her fishing business.

Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional wood, paints, bamboo and fishing net

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Editha works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pre-paid mobile loading. Editha is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc. for her general store business.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Famille Tembeaone Group

texts.fr: Pour lui permettre de se prendre en charge dans ses études, le père de Dominique l'a initié à la culture du café. Effectivement, cette activité a contribué à sa scolarisation de Dominique et en fait de même pour ses enfants. Quoique les travaux de sarclage sont coûteux, il espère réaliser une bonne récolte afin de concrétiser son projet de construction d'une maison. Sur la photo, il est accompagné par son épouse.
texts.en: In order to be able to provide for Dominique's education, his father  taught him how to cultivate coffee. Indeed, this  business paid for Dominique's schooling and now serves the same purpose for his own children. Although weeding is costly, he hopes to have a good harvest and be able to realize his dream of building a house. On the photo he is shown together with his wife.

loans.use: to plant coffee on a new land plot.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, compost, and foliar spray to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Masae

texts.en: Masae is 51 years old and married with 4 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. Masae has requested a loan to buy bag of flour, yeast, sugar, baking powder, cooking oil, containers, etc. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. Masae will use her earnings to support her family and to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy bag of sugar, flour, yeast,c ooking oil, baking powder, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 23-year-old woman who is single with 1 child. She runs a business selling elei in her community. She has 1 year of experience with this business. Josephine has requested a loan to buy materials, paints, design board, etc. She plans to use her profits to support her family financially. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, design board, paints, etc.

loans.name: Taumaloto

texts.en: Taumaloto is 64 years old, married and the mother of ten children. She has a small plantation where she grows cabbage, tomatoes, and cucumbers to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years and is requesting a loan to buy supplies, including fertilizer, a weed sprayer, bush knives, a wheel barrow, rakes and more. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012 and plans to use her profits to expand her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Carla Fabiana

texts.es:
Carla es una mujer de 37 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de golosinas.
Ella es emprendedora, de buen trato, paciente, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en una calle muy concurrida situada en el centro de la ciudad, un área caracterizada por el comercio en todas las áreas, y alberga a universidades, oficinas públicas y empresas privadas que conviven lado a lado, de clima frío y seco, con una temperatura ambiente entre 5-19 grados centígrados que varía durante el día.
Carla es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa suelto, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su madre que se dedica al mismo negocio, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de golosinas como; galletas de todo tipo, dulces de todo sabor, chicles, maní, chocolates, refrescos y otros. Actividad que realiza de lunes a  sábado en un puesto de venta fijo en el horario de día. “inicié mi negocio ayudando a mi madre desde muy joven, luego conseguí un puesto de venta y me independicé…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que se encuentra al lado de un colegio y en una calle muy céntrica dónde los clientes pasan continuamente. Su sueño es darle una vida más satisfactoria a su madre que no trabaja por la edad, ella desea realiza la compra de mercadería para su kiosko para mejorar sus ventas en la época alta del año. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 16 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Carla solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedades de golosinas para vender en su kiosko y cuidar a su madre.
texts.en:
Carla is a 37-year-old woman, single, with no children, and her business is selling snacks. She is enterprising, fair, patient, pleasant, responsible, and very hard-working. 

She carries out her business on a very busy street in the center of the city. It is an area characterized by all areas of commerce, and home to universities, public offices, and private companies that exist side by side. It has a cool, dry, climate, with an ambient temperature between 5 and 19 degrees centigrade, which varies throughout the day.

Carla has tan skin and long, black, hair that she wears loose, and brown eyes.  She is short of stature, and delicately built.  Her mother tongue is Aymara, which she speaks with family; she speaks Spanish with the general public and for business.  She lives with her mother, who devotes herself to the same business.  They live in their own home, made of brick, with a corrugated iron roof. It has potable water, electricity, and sewer service.

Her business is selling snacks, such as all types of cookies, sweets of every flavor, chewing gum, peanuts, chocolates, soft drinks, and others.  She carries out her activity from Monday to Saturday, in a sales kiosk, on a fixed daily schedule.   “I started my business helping my mother when I was very young;   later, I obtained a sales kiosk and became independent…” she says. Her business has the advantage of being located next to a high school, on a very central street where customers pass continuously.  

Her dream is to give her mother, who doesn’t work because of her age, a better life.  She wants to purchase merchandise for her kiosk, in order to improve her sales in the high season. This is the first loan cycle with the institution in the sixteen years that she has been carrying out this activity independently.

These are the reasons that Carla is requesting a loan: to purchase a variety of snacks, and to take care of her mother.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of snacks to sell in her kiosk, and take care of her mother.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes es una mujer de 62 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de alimentos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio.
Ella es emprendedora, constante, comprometida con su trabajo, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘cosmos 79’ dónde se encuentra el Estadio Andino del mismo nombre, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-15 grados centígrados.
Lourdes es de tez trigueña, cabello castaño largo lo usa amarrado, ojos obscuros, usa lentes de aumento, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad, como; pan, azúcar, arroz, fideo, harina, huevos, golosinas, refrescos, detergente, etc., actividad que realiza de lunes a domingo durante todo el día en una tienda de barrio en su propio domicilio. La ventaja de su negocio es la proximidad que tiene al estadio de futbol eso hace que clientes constantes y casuales se acerquen a comprar especialmente los fines de semana, la desventaja es que el lugar es alejado y para abastecer su negocio debe recorrer grandes distancias. “inicie mi negocio porque una vecina era dueña de la tienda y por motivos de viaje me la traspasó, le agregue unas cuantas cositas y el negocio marcha bien…” comenta. Su sueño es consolidar su tienda y mejorarla hasta convertirla en micromarket, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de alimentos, artículos de primera necesidad y estantes donde acomodar los productos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 8 meses que viene desarrollando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Lourdes solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería y estantes para su tienda para incrementar sus ventas hasta volverla micromarket.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a 62-year-old woman, single, with no children, and her business is selling basic pantry food in her neighborhood store.

She is enterprising, dependable, committed to her work, responsible, and very hard-working. Her business is in the "Cosmos 79" zone, where the Estadio Andino is found. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day from 0-15 degrees centigrade.

Lourdes has olive skin, long brown hair she keeps tied up, dark eyes, wears glasses, is short and thin, her native language is Aymará, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for her business. Her business is selling food and basic pantry items such as bread, sugar, rice, beans, flour, eggs, sweets, soft drinks, detergent, etc., work she does from Monday to Sunday for the whole day in a neighborhood store in her own home. The advantage of her business is its proximity to the soccer stadium, which causes regular and occasional customers to come to make purchases, especially on the weekends. The disadvantage is that it is in a distant location and to stock her business, she has to go a long distance. "I began my business because a neighbor was the owner of the store and for reasons of travel, she gave it to me. I added a number of small things and the business is going well..." she says. Her dream is to strengthen her store and improve it until it becomes a micromarket. She wants to expand her business by buying food, basic pantry items, and shelves to accommodate her products. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 8 months that she has been doing this work independently.

For these reasons, Lourdes asks for a loan to purchase merchandise and shelves for her store to increase her sales to become a micromarket. v

loans.use: to purchase merchandise and shelves for her store to increase her sales to become a micromarket.

loans.name: Malae

texts.en:
Malae is 38 years old and married with four children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years.

Malae has requested a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, etc.

She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Malae will pay for her children's education and support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Tafale

texts.en:
Tafale is 38 years old and married with four children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as sugar, salt, rice, snacks, soft drinks, etc. She has been doing this for five years. 

Tafale needs a loan to buy a new freezer, chickens, a bag of flour, a box of corned beef, a box of tin fish, etc. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business and also to support her family. She became a member of SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new freezer, chickens, a bag of flour, a box of corned beef, a box of tin fish, etc.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros engages in fishing. She sells fish to earn a living. She is a 33-year-old married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 16, and the youngest is 9.

Aside from that, she also engages in a lechon (roasted pig) vending business. For almost 15 years now, she has been in that kind of business.

She is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials and additional capital for her lechon business. This will enable her to improve her business and be able to settle her obligations. With this, she will be able to provide her family with a nutritious diet and better living conditions.

In the future, Milagros dreams to expand her business for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials and additional capital for her lechon business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase bundles of fishing net for her fishing business.

Lorna has been in this business for 15 years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fishing net.

loans.name: Narissa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Narissa works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell charcoal.  Narissa is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like spices, flour, cooking oil, etc. for her food vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Narissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like spices, flour, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 45 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Susan is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Susan has been farming vegetables for ten years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to cover the costs of labor for land maintenance, mulching and harvesting.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Sylvia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and direct-selling Avon products. Sylvia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy charcoal to sell for her buy-and-sell charcoal business.

Sylvia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Lucy

texts.en:
Ma. Lucy is 55 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Ma. Lucy is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ma. Lucy has been farming sugarcane for seven years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money to buy more farmlands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Tuusao

texts.en: Tuusao is 67 years old, married, and the mother of 10 children. She has a small plantation where she grows cabbage, tomatoes, beans, and other items to earn a living. She has been doing this for six years and has requested a loan to buy a wheel barrow, vegetable seeds, a weed sprayer, rakes, bush knives, and other items. She has been a member of SBPD since 2008 and plans to use her profits to expand her business and develop another new profitable business that she can use to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, rakes, bush knives, a wheel barrow, vegetable seeds, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farming supplies (tomatoes, carrots, chili peppers and green beans) so he can increase his production output and pay for house repairs.

loans.name: Ancha

texts.pt:
A Sra Ancha tem 35 anos de idade, mae de duas filhas, das quais uma frenquenta o ensino primário de 2º grau (7ª classe) e a outra frequenta a pré- primária( escolinha). Ela é casada e vive na casa própria e, nao sustenta mais ninguém.
Tem uma Mercearia no seu quintal e com o financiamento, pretende reforçar o seu negócio comprando produtos tais como: carne, arroz, vinagre, feijao, peixe carrapau, refrescos e cerveja para revender e, sonha em ser uma empresária, tem como desafio trabalhar muito para alcançar o seu sonho.
texts.en:
Ms Ancha is 35 years old and the mother of two daughters, one of whom goes to primary school (7th grade) and another who is still in kindergarden. She's married, lives in a house she owns and doesn't support anyone else.

She owns a grocery stall in her back yard and with this loan she plans to reinforce her business by buying products such as: rice, vinegar, beans, mackerel, sodas and beer for resale. She dreams of being a businesswoman and her challenge is to work hard to reach her dreams.

loans.use: buy products such as: rice, vinegar, beans, mackerel, sodas and beer for resale.

loans.name: Toafa

texts.en:
Toafa is 32 years old and single with no children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as snacks, drinks, food stock, chicken, etc. She has been doing this for one year.

Toafa needs a loan to buy food stock, drinks, bags of flour, bags of sugar, etc.

She hopes to use her profits to extend her business to become a supermarket and buy new products to sell in her shop. She became a member of SPBD in 2015 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, bags of flour, boxes of chicken, boxes of mutton, boxes of noodles, etc.

loans.name: Ilda

texts.pt:
A Sr. Ilda de 36 anos de idade casada e mae de 6 filhos dos quais 5 estao afrequentar a escola  no ensino primario e secundario 1 è menor de idade para  frequentar a escola. Ela è agricultora informal de culturas de tomate, pimenta, repolho e mais diversos produtos, actividade que esta a explorar junto com seus filhos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar  insumos agricola (sementes de tomate, pimenta e repolho) para aumentar o volume da sua produtividade e sustento da sua familia.
Tem como grande desafio melhorar as condicoes de habitacao e a dieta almentar.
texts.en:
Ilda is 36 years old and married. She has six children, five of whom attend primary and secondary school and one hasn't reached school age yet. She's an informal farmer who grows tomatoes, chillis, cabbage and various other produce, a business she runs alongside her children.
The current loan will be used to purchase farming supplies (tomato, chilli and cabbage seeds) so that she can increase her production output and support her family.
Her great challenge is imporving her living conditions and her diet.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies (tomato, chilli and cabbage seeds) so that she can increase her production output.

loans.name: Menime

texts.en: Menime is 32 years old and married with 5 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for four years. Menime has requested a loan to buy a bag of flour, bag of sugar, yeast, cooking oil, plastic bags, etc. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. Menime will use her earnings to extend her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, bag of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, cooking oil, etc,.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.pt:
A Sra Adelina, de 32 anos de idade, solteira e mae de uma filha que frequenta a 4a classe. Para além da sua filha, sustenta ainda uma sobrinha que frequenta também a 4ª classe.
Tem uma Mercearia no seu quintal e com o financiamento, pretende reforçar o seu volume de negócio comprando produtos tais como: arroz, vinagre, feijao, peixe carrapau, refrescos e cerveja para revender e sonha em ter uma loja bem grande que tenha todo tipo de produtos, todavia, para almejar o seu sonho, tem o desafio de trabalhar arduamente, pese embora enfrenta dificuldades financeiras.
texts.en:
Ms Adelina is 32 years old, single and the mother of one daughter who's in 4th grade. As well as her daughter she also supports a niece who's also in 4th grade.

She owns a grocery stall in her back yard and with this loan she plans to reinforce the volume of her business by buying products such as: rice, vinegar, beans, mackerel, sodas and beer for resale. She dreams of owning a big store that sells all kinds of products, however, to get to this dream her challenge is to work hard despite her financial difficulties.

loans.use: buy products such as: rice, vinegar, beans, mackerel, sodas and beer for resale

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly is a 55-year-old man from a remote area of Siem Reap Province. He is a father of two children. To make a living, he runs a business buying and selling cows and earns, on average, USD 10.00 per day. He has been in this type of business for 25 years. 

Ly would like to improve his living standards by having clean energy for household use. Because of the lack of capital, he is asking for a loan to build a biogas digester, under the project of NBP (National Biogas Program) partnering with HKL. After an initial investment in this system, he hopes that he won’t spend much money on fuel and lessen smoke from wood or charcoal. He is very happy and thankful because with this kind of loan product, HKL has offered a special interest rate different from its general loans. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a biogas digester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in her business with more articles of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sarim

texts.en:
Sarim, 41, lives in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she opened a small store to sell all types of vegetables to people in her community. So far, she has been involved in this type of business for 15 years. She is able to make an income of USD $3.00 per day, on average.

Her husband, Kong, 41, is a Tuk Tuk (motor rickshaw) driver and earns, on average, USD $5.00 a day. The current Tuk Tuk that the family owns is pretty old and needs to be replaced a new one. That is why Sarim is applying for a Kiva to buy a new Tuk Tuk for her husband. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a new Tuk Tuk (motor rickshaw) for her husband

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is 57 years of age, married and blessed with six children. Four of her children have settled for marriage while the other two are still attending to school. She has owned and operated her general store for more than 15 years. She also raises hogs as an additional source of income. With her determination and hard work she was able to help her husband in generating income.

Soledad would like to borrow additional capital of PHP 18,000. This loan will be used to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, canned goods, assorted biscuits and cooking oil. She hopes that her general store will continuously grow more so that she wil be able to increase her income and satisfy her customers' demands.

loans.use: to be use in buying grocery items for her general store

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 47 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell electronic gadgets business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of electronic gadgets to sell.

Mercedita has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell electronic gadgets business for four years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of electronic gdgets to sell

loans.name: Edda

texts.en:
Edda is 49 years old and married with nine children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, chips, etc.

Edda has borrowed and paid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, chips, etc

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby works hard to support her family. Ruby is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase materials like wood, plastic rope, bamboo, paints, etc., for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

Ruby has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Ruby would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials like wood, plastic rope, bamboo, paints, etc., for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie works hard to support her family. Melanie is married and has a buying and selling of ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines.

Melanie requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items of ready-to-wear clothing to sell like T-shirts, shirts, shorts, etc.

Melanie has been in this business for three years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items of ready-to-wear clothing to sell like T-shirts, shirts, shorts, etc

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 48 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming bananas in the Philippines. Cecelia is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers and pay for laborers' salaries for cleaning the farm.

Cecelia has been farming bananas for 3 years and also earns additional income from selling bananas.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers and pay for laborers' salaries for cleaning the farm.

loans.name: Cherrylyn

texts.en:
Cherrylyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional young coconuts, plastic cups, etc. for her food vending business.

Cherrylyn has been in this business for sixteen years. She earns additional income from farming rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional young coconuts, plastic cups, etc.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 53 years old and widowed with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, coffee, sugar, milk, etc.

Elvira has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, coffee, sugar, milk, etc

loans.name: Annalie

texts.en:
Annalie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Annalie is 41 years old and both of her children are in school.

Annalie has a general store business in the Philippines. Annalie requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods like rice, snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

Annalie has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Annalie would like to save enough money in order to support her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase more goods like rice, snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Injeliha

texts.en:
Injeliha is 54 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a loan of 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Injeliha has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business for 5 years and also earns an income from raising goats.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizer, liquid fertilizer to apply to the leaves, and more, to care for her coffee plants.

loans.name: Ronald Eduardo

texts.es:
Ronald es un hombre sincero y perseverante, tiene 26 años de edad tiene una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre cuatro y seis años, viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Ronald es un padre de familia que se preocupa por sus hijos y para generar sus ingresos trabaja desde hace 6 años en una empresa como copiloto de un camión que circula por las comunidades circunvecinas de su pueblo, este trabajo es muy bonito pero cansado.
Desde hace algún tiempo Ronald había pensado en comprar un carro que lo utilizara para que su familia tenga donde movilizarse en los momentos que lo necesiten, pero no había tenido la posibilidad de hacerlo, pero ahora a él se le ha presentado una oferta y Ronald ha decidido comprar un carro tipo pic-up; pero él tiene una dificultad que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para realizar la compra, entonces Ronald ha decido solicitar un crédito con el afán de completar el capital.
El gran sueño de Ronald es comprar su carro, construir una casa y brindarle a sus hijos la mejor  educación
texts.en:
Ronald is a sincere and determined man. He is 26 years old, and has a lovely family of two children between the ages of four and six, and they live in a community in Sololá.

Ronald is a father who is concerned for his children and to generate his income, has worked for six years at a business as a co-pilot of a truck that goes around the neighboring communities of his village. This work is nice but tiring.

For some time, Ronald has thought about buying a car that he will use so that his family has a way to get around at the times it needs to, but he has not had the possibility to do it.  But now, an opportunity has presented itself and Ronald has decided to buy a pick-up style car, but he has a challenge which is not having enough money to make the purchase. So, Ronald has decided to ask for a loan with the desire of having enough capital.

Ronald's great dream is to purchase a car, build a house, and offer his children a better education.

loans.use: to purchase a car for his own use.

loans.name: Asociacion Panimache Cuarto Group

texts.es:
Juan es un padre de familia trabajador y honrado, tiene 52 años cuenta con una linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre siete y veintinueve  años, viven en una comunidad de San Andrés Semetabaj.
Juan (es el que esta en medio de la fotografía de chumpa morada) es un hombre que cuida y protege mucho la naturaleza porque para él es la fuente de sus buenas cosechas, Juan para generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 18 años cultivando una diversidad de hortalizas como frijol, maíz, abas y arveja.
Juan con el afán de sembrar en esta época de milpa ha empezado a preparar sus semilla de maíz, pero una de las dificultades que Juan tiene es que no cuenta con terreno propio es por eso que el alquila, y para poder sembrar el deberá pagar la renta del terreno; pero Juan no cuenta con el dinero para pagar el alquiler por tal motivo el a organizado a un grupo de personas con el  mismo objetivo para  solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizan para pagar el alquiler del terreno.
El gran anhelo de Juan es seguir sembrando maíz para que su familia no parezca de hambre.
texts.en:
Juan is a hard-working and honest father. He is 52 years old and has a lovely family of four children between the ages of seven and twenty-nine. They live in a community in San Andrés Semetabaj.

Juan (he is the one in the middle of the photo with a purple jacket) is a man who cares for and protects nature a lot because, for him, it is the source of his good harvests. Juan, to generate his income and support his family, has worked in agriculture for the past 18 years, growing a variety of crops such as beans, corn, broad beans and peas. 

Juan, with desire to plant in this corn season has begun to prepare his corn seeds, but one of the difficulties that Juan has is that he doesn't have his own land, and for this reason he rents, and to be able to plant he has to pay the land rental. But Juan doesn't have the money to pay the rent, so he has organized a group of people with the same goal to ask for a loan that they will use to pay land rental. 

Juan's great desire is to continue growing corn so that his family doesn't go hungry.

loans.use: to pay for land rental.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge es amable y generoso tiene 54 años de edad es casado, tiene una linda familia de cinco hijos de las edades entre dieciocho y veintinueve años, viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Jorge para obtener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando arveja china y tomate, esta actividad él lo realiza desde hace 10 años, Jorge con el deseo de mejorar sus ingresos cuenta también con una pequeña tienda de consumo diario, en la localidad de su comunidad, gracias a estas dos actividades ha logrado que su familia tenga lo necesario.
Jorge ya tiene preparado la tierra, pero lo que el necesita son sus semillas de tomates  y fertilizantes, Jorge ha buscado la mejor manera de poder conseguir su capital y sembrar, y la mejor solución es solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá en su cultivo y con lo que genere de ganancias podrá pagar su crédito.
El gran sueño de Jorge es que con esta inversión mejorara sus ingresos y podrá apoyar a sus hijos a construir su casa.
texts.en:
Jorge is friendly and generous. He is 54 years old, married, has a lovely family of five children between the ages of eighteen and twenty-nine, and they live in a community in Sololá.

Jorge, to earn an income and support his family, works in agriculture, growing snow peas and tomatoes, work that he has been doing for 10 years. Jorge, with the desire to increase his income, also has a small store with everyday products, in a retail space in his community. Thanks to these two jobs, he has managed to give his family what it needs.

Jorge has prepared the land, but what he needs are the tomato seeds and fertilizers. Jorge has looked for the best way to be able to get capital and plant, and the best solution is to ask for a loan which he will invest in his crop and with which he will generate earnings with which he will pay off his loan. 

Jorge's big dream is that with this investment, he will increase his income and be able to help his children to build their house.

loans.use: to purchase tomato seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Oeun's Group

texts.en: Oeun, who is 54 years old, lives in a rural village in Kampot province. She has five children and supports her family by growing rice and raising chickens and pigs. She has requested her first loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Ouen leads a two-person loan group, and will use her portion of this loan to build a decent latrine. She hopes that this will improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Roly

texts.en: Roly is 28 years old and living with his parents. Roly works making bread and he also repairs cell phones. Roly is determined to open a bookstore and library so he needs your help. Roly learned that he can manage that kind of business and he will support it with his other jobs. Roly also wants to go to college in the future. He hopes you can trust him again with this loan.

loans.use: to open a bookstore and library

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.pt:
O senhor  Ernesto é comerciante de 57 anos de idade casado pai de 7 filhos dos quais 4 sao maiores de idade e ja vivem em suas casas 3 a estudar e a viver com ele na casa propria alem destes sustenta 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ele.
Diz que com este crédito irá comprar refrescos, cervejas, vinhos, sumos, acucar, farinha, massas para reforcar o seu negocio. 
Diz que seu sonho crescer no negocio conseguindo responder as necessidades de seus cliente.
Principais desafios insuficiência de fundos e elevado custo de vida para ultrapassá los faz xitique  e tem  uma conta onde faz depósitos como forma de poupar e que irá levantar mais créditos como forma de alcançar seus objectivos.
texts.en:
Ernesto is a 57-year-old vendor. He's married and has seven children, four of whom are adults and have their own homes. Three of his children are in school and live with him in a house that he owns. Aside from them, he supports two nephews who live with him.
He states that with this loan he'll purchase refreshments, beer, wine, juice, sugar, flour and noodles so that he can stock his business.
He states that his dream is to make his business grow and meet his customers' needs.
His main challenges are the lack of funds and the high cost of living. In order to overcome them, he uses rotating credit as well as a savings account. He also states that he'll get more loans in order to accomplish his goals.

loans.use: to purchase refreshments, beer, wine, juice, sugar, flour and noodles.

loans.name: Sembrando Esperanza Group

texts.es: Zoraida tiene 44 años de edad es soltera con un hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de chirimoya palta tunas el negocio lo empezó a través de su mama ya que tenia sembríos. En la actualidad la socia cultiva frutas tales como palta chirimoya. el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para mejorar su producción. Ella es socia del grupo “SEMBRANDO ESPERANZA”. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Zoraida es la primera del lado derecho.
texts.en: Zoraida is 44 years old, single, with a dependent child. She works selling custard apple, avocado, and fruit from the prickly pear cactus. She began the business through her mother, since she had a sown field. Currently, she grows fruit such as avocado and custard apple. The loan will be invested in the purchase of fertilizer to improve her production. She is a member of the “SEMBRANDO ESPERANZA” group. The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the offered loan. Zoraida is the first on the left.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 55 años de edad, soltera, tiene una hija independiente, y su negocio es la venta de pollos al espiedo.
Ella es emprendedora, generosa, sincera, amable, comprensiva, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona de ‘Pampahasi’; sitio caracterizado por encontrarse sobre una ladera de la ciudad, donde las calles son pendientes/empinadas y por sus orígenes; campesino aymaras que pelearon por la liberación del yugo español y se asentaron en ese lugar como trinchera. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-14 grados centígrados, durante todo el año
María es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hija que trabaja y con sus 2 nietos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida rápida como; pollos al espiedo (pollo condimentado cocinado al horno), salchipapas (salchichas y papas fritas en aceite) y hamburguesas. Actividad que realiza de lunes a domingo en un cuarto habilitado como snack, dónde sus clientes se acomodan a disfrutar de su comida. Inicio su negocio por la necesidad de alimentar a su familia, actualmente cuenta con una ayudante que se encarga de pelar las papas, realizar las compras y otras actividades. La ventaja de su negocio es la proximidad a oficinas y comercios que son clientes constantes. “trabajo por necesidad y por el bienestar de mis nietos, son 2 y mi hija sola no abastece con los gastos…” comenta. Su sueño es comprarse una casa, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de una máquina broastera y una espiadera, para vender pollo a la broaster y cocinar papas en abundancia. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina broastera y una espiadera para cocinar pollo y ayudar con los gastos de sus nietos.
texts.en:
María is a 55-year-old woman, single, who has an independent daughter, and her business is selling rotisserie chicken. 

She is enterprising, generous, sincere, friendly, understanding, responsible, and hard-working. Her business is in the "Pampahasi" zone, a place characterized by being found on a hillside of the city, where the streets are sloped/steep, and for its origins of Aymara people from the countryside who fought for the liberation from the Spanish yoke and settled in this trench-like place. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 2-14 degrees centigrade during the whole year. 

María has brown skin, long black hair she keeps tied up, brown eyes, is short, of medium stature, her native language is Aymará which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and the work she does. She shares her life with her daughter and with her 2 grandchildren who go to school. They live in their own room built of brick, with a roof of metal laminate sheeting that has drinking water, electricity, and sewer services. Her business is selling fast food such as rotisserie chicken (seasoned chicken cooked in an oven), salchipapas (sausages and potatoes fried in oil) and hamburgers. She does this work from Monday to Sunday in a room fixed up as a food stall, where her customers sit to enjoy their food. She began her business due to the necessity of feeding her family. Currently, she has an assistant who is in charge of peeling the potatoes, making the food, and doing other work. The advantage of her business is the proximity to offices and businesses which are regular customers. "I work by necessity and for the well-being of my grandchildren, they are 2 and my daughter alone can't cover all of their expenses..." she says. Her dream is to buy a house, she wants to expand her business through purchasing a deep fryer and a rotisserie oven to sell fried chicken and cook a lot of potatoes. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 15 years that she has been doing this work. 

For these reasons, María asks for a loan to purchase a deep fryer and a rotisserie oven to cook children and help with the expenses of her grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase a deep fryer and a rotisserie oven to cook chicken and help with the expenses for her grandchildren.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida, 46,  is a married woman with four children from Talibon, Bohol. Her oldest child is 12 and the youngest is 4. She engages in a seaweed farming business. She grows and sells seaweed.  In addition to that, she also engages in rice farming. She toils the land and grows rice. This is the source of her income. Her husband is a foreman. His income is of great help for the family's needs.

She is asking for a loan to buy seaweed seedlings and fertilizers for the farm. These will help her farming business gain more yield, thus creating higher earnings and enabling her to expand both of her sources of income.  

 Aida dreams to handle her business successfully to become more sustainable and able to provide for the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings and fertilizers for the farm

loans.name: Jelita

texts.en:
Jelita is 49 years old, married, and has three children.

She is in the agricultural poultry business in the Philippines. Jelita requested a loan of 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her chicks.

Jelita has been in the poultry business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her chicks.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Emelia is 46 years old and has 3 children who are in school.

Emelia has a business selling plastic-wares in the Philippines. Emelia requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of plastic-wares to sell.

Emelia has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Emelia would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of plastic-wares to sell.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is 37 years old and married with 7 children, 5 of whom are in school. Crisanta works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Crisanta has been in this business for three years. 

In the future Crisanta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc

loans.name: Campo Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo tiene 22 años de edad, el es un joven muy trabajador  que se dedica al jornal de trabajos de agricultura y a la crianza de animales, Eduardo y sus hermanos no han podido terminar sus estudios por  falta de recursos económicos,  Eduardo vive con sus 3 hermanos  ya que comenta que su madre falleció hace 4 años atrás y su padre vive lejos de ellos por motivo de trabajo, Eduardo va  a invertir el dinero de crédito en la compra de terneros para mejorar su negocio y asi mismo aumentare sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hermanos.
texts.en: Eduardo is 22 years old, is a hard-working young man who works as a day laborer with agricultural work and raising animals. Eduardo and his siblings have not been able to finish their schooling due to the lack of economic resources. Eduardo lives with his 3 siblings, and says that his mother died 4 years ago, and his father lives far from them due to work. Eduardo will invest the money from the loan in the purchase of calves to improve his business and also to increase his income to improve the quality of life of his siblings.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is an old client who has applied for a loan of UGX 3,000,000. His major source of income is a retail shop, which he has had for 10 years. His major challenge is limited capital, which affects his sales. James joined Ugafode to access financial support, expand his business, and earn more income. 

James applied for this loan to buy more stock for his shop including posho, sugar, sodas, and beer. His dream is to expand his retail shop into a wholesale business. James thanks UGAFODE for this financial assistance, which has enabled him to educate his children, sustain his business, and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy more stock for his store, including posho, sugar, sodas, and beer

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is married, 28 years old, and has 2 children who are 3 and 1 year old. He lives in a rural setting with his family and he is a farmer who deals in passion fruits and vegetable growing.

He started the farming business in 1994 and he works six days in a week, 8 hours each day. He started this business in order to earn a living since he did not go to school. He has acquired this loan in order to buy fertilizers and be able to harvest goods with high quality and in large quantities.

His customers are traders from areas around him and he hopes to be the leading supplier of passion fruits in his area. However, he still faces the challenge of lack of enough capital and unpredictable weather changes. He describes himself as a hardworking man and honest.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Nugzar

texts.en:
Nugzar is a 43-year-old married man from the small village of Lashe. Nugzar and his wife live with their student daughter and son. To take care of his family’s everyday needs, Nugzar is engaged in cattle breeding, in beekeeping, and in the cultivation of family-owned agricultural land. He sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family’s income. 

As it becomes harder to earn a living over time, Nugzar wants to start an additional business in order to more effectively meet the daily costs of the family. A loan of 3,200 GEL will be a great support to this hardworking man and his family, enabling him to purchase all needed equipment and tools and open a block factory. His customers will be locals and also the people from nearby villages. Nugzar will generate a significant source of income and will meet all daily costs more effectively. Nugzar and his family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will greatly appreciate their support.

loans.use: To open a block factory and get a significant source of income

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Luljeta

texts.en:
Luljeta is 49 and a mother of two, aged 23 and 17. The reason why she needs this loan is to buy a computer and, with the rest of the money, to buy more inventory items for her village grocery store, which she has been operating for nine years. Recently, Luljeta designated a corner of the store where she plans to put a computer so children in the village who do not have computers at home can use hers at a very low price.

Luljeta’s family lives in a village with a very cold climate that is situated in a mountain. Villagers here have lots of orchards with cherries and apples, in addition to their medicinal flowers and other plants including potatoes, onions, corn, and wheat.

loans.use: to buy inventory items for her village grocery store and also a computer to put in a corner of the store where children from families who don't have a computer at home can use it

loans.name: Fillor

texts.en: Fillor wants to plant for the spring season and he needs to buy seeds for this. In addition to planting potatoes, onions, red peppers and wheat, he also has two dairy cows and two calves at the moment, from which he sells to a nearby dairy farm roughly 10 liter of raw milk at a price of $4 in total per day. As far as food for the animals, he has rented from other villagers about 7 dynyms of land where he plants animal feed such as fodder and vetch.

loans.use: to buy onion and potato seeds for planting.

loans.name: Isaura Rosario

texts.es:
Isaura es una mujer trabajadora de 30 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades de entre cinco y diez años.
Isaura una madre de familia que ama y protege a sus hijos, ella para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa se dedica al tejido de ropas típicas de su región y también las vende en una plaza de su comunidad, ella tiene ya 4 años de realizar esta labor.
Isaura desde muy joven siempre le ha gustado el comercio, es por eso que su gran anhelo es hacer de su negocio de ropa típica algo más grande,   pero ella no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder realizar esta inversión, entonces ella ha tomado la iniciativa de solicitar un crédito que lo invertirá en su pequeño negocio de compra y venta de ropa típica. Isaura tiene las esperanzas de conseguir el préstamo para hacer sus sueños realidad.
texts.en:
Isaura, age 30, is a hard-working woman.  She is married and has a beautiful family with three children between the ages of five and ten.  Isaura is a mother who loves and protects her children.  In order to help her husband with the household expenses, she weaves clothing that is typical of her region.  She sells the clothing at a plaza in her community.  She has been doing this work for four years.

Isaura has liked commerce ever since she was very young.  That is why her big desire is to make her typical clothing business somewhat bigger.  However, she does not have sufficient capital to be able to make this investment.

Therefore, she has taken the initiative to request a loan.  She will use the loan to invest in her small business of buying and selling typical clothes.  Isaura hopes to get the loan in order to make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy and sell typical clothing.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru:
Гулноре 25 лет. Она живет вместе с мамой, сестренкой и братом. Но ее брат сейчас находиться за границей на заработках. Гулнора в свои юные годы уже потерпела развод с мужем. Как и любому человеку Гулноре было нелегко пережить этот период своей жизни. Но взяв все в свои руки, она начала новую жизнь. Гулнора вышла на работу. Она теперь профессиональная швея. Гулнора научилась шить у своей бабушки. Начав швейное дело, ее жизнь изменилась к лучшему. Она общается с новыми людьми, занимается любимым делом и проводит время с пользой. 
Гулнора хочет купить новую швейную машинку, чтобы ускорить процесс работы и улучшить качество работы. Профессиональная машинка стоить дорого и Гулнора обратилась за кредитом, потому что для нее и ее деятельности эта покупка является необходимым. Гулнора знает и верит, что Вы сможете ей помочь, и заранее благодарит Вас за поддержку.
texts.en:
Gulnora is 25 years old.  She lives with her mom, her younger sister and her brother.  Her brother, however, is currently making a living abroad.  Although she is still very young, Gulnora has already gone through a divorce with her husband.  Of course she had a very difficult time going through this period of her life.  However, she decided to take things in her own hands and to start a new life and start working.  Gulnora is now a professional seamstress.  She learned this trade from her grandmother.  After she started her own business, her life started to improve.  She now has contact with new people, she's involved in an activity which she loves and she spends her time doing something useful.

Gulnora wants to buy a new sewing machine in order to work faster and improve the quality of her work.  A professional sewing machine costs a lot of money, so Gulnora is taking a loan because this purchase is very important to her, professionally.  Gulnora is confident that she will receive your help, and she thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to buy a professional sewing machine.

loans.name: Unidos Para El Progreso Group

texts.es: Betsy tiene 38 años de edad es casada con dos hijos dependientes. Ella tiene un salón de belleza. Y a la vez  vende productos de belleza lencería y calzados lo cual le permite apoyar a su esposo en la educación de sus dos hijos menores. Con las ganancias pagara las cuotas de su departamento que lo compro a plazos. El crédito lo usara en la compra de mas sandalias y productos de belleza Ella participa en el grupo “UNIDOS PARA EL PROGRESO”. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Betsy es la segunda del lado derecho. Y de la misma manera se encuentra adjuntada la foto de Jesús en la parte superior izquierda que no pudo estar presente en la reunión por motivos laborales.
texts.en: Betsy is 38 years old, married, with two dependent children. She has a beauty salon and she also sells beauty products, lingerie, and shoes which allow her to support her husband in educating their two young children. With the earnings, she will pay the fees for her apartment which she bought in installments. The loan will be used to purchase more sandals and beauty products.  She participates in the "Unidos para el Progreso" group. The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the offered loan. Betsy is the second from the right, and also Jesús is in the attached photo in the upper left because he couldn't be at the meeting due to work reasons.

loans.use: to purchase more sandals and beauty products.

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mlongo has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business

With the loan Mlongo is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour

loans.name: Maria Pastora
